Exercise Description:
1. Stand facing a wall at arm’s length, feet hip-width apart.
2. Place your palms flat on the wall at shoulder height, slightly wider than shoulder-width.
3. Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels, core engaged.
4. Bend your elbows slightly outward (not fully to the sides) and lower your chest toward the wall.
5. Press through your palms to return to the starting position, then repeat for desired reps.

Exercise Description:
1. Start on all fours with your hands flat on the floor, slightly wider than shoulder-width
2. Walk your hands forward and shift your weight so your body forms a straight line from head to knees.
3. Keep your core engaged and your elbows at a slight angle (not flared fully to the sides).
4. Lower your chest toward the floor in a controlled motion.
5. Press through your palms to return to the starting position, then repeat for desired reps.

Exercise Description:
1. Start in a high plank position with your hands flat on the floor, slightly wider than shoulder-width, and your body in a straight line from head to heels.
2. Engage your core and keep your neck neutral.
3. Bend your elbows at a slight angle (not fully to the sides) and lower your chest toward the floor in a controlled motion.
4. Press through your palms to straighten your arms and return to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, keeping your form consistent.
Audio Script: Start in a high plank with your hands a little wider than your shoulders and your body straight from head to heels. Keep your core tight and your neck neutral. Bend your elbows to lower your chest toward the floor, then press back up to the start. Repeat with control.

Exercise Description:
1. Start in a high plank position with your hands placed directly under your shoulders or slightly closer together.
2. Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels, core engaged.
3. Bend your elbows close to your body as you lower your chest toward the floor in a controlled motion.
4. Press through your palms to straighten your arms and return to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, maintaining elbows close throughout.

Exercise Description:
1. Place a loop resistance band around your upper back and secure the ends under your palms on the floor.
2. Start in a high plank position with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width and your body in a straight line from head to heels.
3. Engage your core and keep your neck neutral.
4. Bend your elbows at a slight angle (not fully to the sides) and lower your chest toward the floor in a controlled motion.
5. Press through your palms against the band’s resistance to return to the starting position, then repeat for the desired number of reps.

Exercise Description:
1. Place two sturdy, equal-height platforms (such as weight plates or push-up handles) slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
2. Start in a high plank position with each hand on a platform, body in a straight line from head to heels, and core engaged.
3. Bend your elbows at a slight angle (not fully to the sides) and lower your chest between the platforms in a controlled motion for a deeper range of motion.
4. Press through your palms to straighten your arms and return to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, maintaining full control throughout.

Exercise Description:
1. Lie on your back on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor and a dumbbell held with both hands above your chest.
2. Keep a slight bend in your elbows and engage your core.
3. Slowly lower the dumbbell in an arc over and behind your head until you feel a stretch in your chest and lats.
4. Pull the dumbbell back over your chest by engaging your chest and back muscles.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, maintaining control of the weight throughout.
Audio Script: Lie on a flat bench with your feet on the floor, holding a dumbbell above your chest. Keep a slight bend in your elbows and your core engaged. Lower the dumbbell back in an arc over your head until you feel a stretch, then pull it back above your chest. Repeat with control.

Animation name: Chest/lying pull over with resistance band cable
Exercise Description:
1. Anchor a resistance band with handles to a sturdy point behind your head while lying on the floor (e.g., the base of a heavy piece of equipment).
2. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat on the floor, and arms extended straight overhead holding the handles.
3. Keep a slight bend in your elbows and engage your core.
4. Pull the handles in an arc until your arms are directly above your chest, squeezing your chest and lats.
5. Slowly return your arms to the starting position overhead in a controlled motion, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Lie on your back with your knees bent and a resistance band anchored behind you. Hold the handles overhead with your arms straight and a slight bend in the elbows. Keep your core tight, pull the handles forward in an arc until they’re above your chest, then slowly return overhead. Repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Sit on the dip machine and adjust the seat height so the handles are level with your lower chest or slightly below.
2. Grasp the handles with a firm grip and position your feet flat on the floor or on the provided footrests.
3. Lean your torso slightly forward while keeping your shoulders down and elbows pointing back.
4. Press the handles downward by extending your elbows until your arms are fully straightened.
5. Slowly return the handles to the starting position in a controlled motion, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Sit on the dip machine with the handles at lower chest level. Grip the handles and place your feet on the floor or footrests. Lean forward slightly, keeping your shoulders down. Press the handles down until your arms are straight, then return slowly to the start. Repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Step onto the assisted dip machine platform and select the desired assistance weight. More weight provides more support.
2. Grasp the parallel bars with your palms facing inward and arms straight, then place your knees (or feet, depending on machine design) on the assistance pad.
3. Lean your torso slightly forward while keeping your shoulders down and elbows pointing back.
4. Lower your body by bending your elbows until your upper arms are about parallel to the floor.
5. Press through your hands to straighten your arms and return to the starting position, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script:
Step onto the assisted dip machine and set the weight for support. Hold the bars with your arms straight and place your knees or feet on the pad. Lean forward slightly, lower until your arms are about parallel to the floor, then press back up to the start. Repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Set the pulleys on a cable machine to chest height and attach D-handles.
2. Stand in the middle, grab the handles, and take a small step forward into a staggered stance for balance.
3. Start with your arms extended out to the sides, elbows slightly bent, and palms facing each other.
4. Bring the handles together in front of your chest in a wide arc, squeezing your chest at the midpoint.
5. Slowly return your arms to the starting position in a controlled motion, then repeat for the desired number of reps.

Exercise Description:

Exercise Description:
1. Set the pulleys on a cable machine to chest or shoulder height and attach D-handles.
2. Stand in the middle, grab the handles with palms facing down, and step forward into a staggered stance.
3. Start with your arms out to the sides, elbows bent.
4. Pull the handles forward and across your body until your hands cross in front of your chest, squeezing your chest muscles.
5. Slowly return to the starting position in control, then alternate which hand crosses on the next rep.

Step forward into a staggered stance with your arms out to the sides and elbows slightly more bent than in a fly. Pull the handles forward and cross them in front of your chest. Squeeze your chest, then return slowly and repeat, alternating the crossover.

Exercise Description:
1. Set the pulleys on a cable machine to the highest setting and attach D-handles.
2. Stand in the middle, grab the handles with palms facing down, and step forward into a staggered stance.
3. Hinge your torso slightly forward at the hips, keeping your back straight.
4. Start with your arms out to the sides and elbows bent.
5. Pull the handles downward and across your body until your hands cross in front of your lower chest or upper abdomen, squeezing your chest muscles.
6. Slowly return to the starting position in control, then alternate which hand crosses on the next rep.

With elbows bent, pull the handles downward and across your body until your hands cross in front of your lower chest. Squeeze your chest, then return slowly and repeat, alternating the crossover.

Exercise Description:
1. Attach a single-grip handle to each loop band and anchor both bands securely behind you at chest height, spaced wide enough to stay clear of your arms.
2. Hold one handle in each hand and step forward into a staggered stance for balance.
3. Start with your arms out to the sides, elbows more bent than in a fly, and palms facing down.
4. Pull the handles forward and across your body until your hands cross in front of your chest, squeezing your chest muscles.
5. Slowly return your arms to the starting position in control, then alternate which hand crosses on the next rep.

Pull the handles forward and cross them in front of your chest. Squeeze your chest, then return slowly and repeat, alternating the crossover.

Exercise Description:
1. Attach a single-grip handle to each loop band and anchor both bands securely high and behind you, spaced wide enough to stay clear of your arms.

Exercise Description:
1. Clip one end of a loop band to a carabiner on the bar.
2. Pass the band through a sturdy anchor point behind you at chest height, then clip the other end to the opposite carabiner on the bar.
3. Stand facing away from the anchor in a staggered stance, gripping the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width.
4. Hold the bar at chest level with elbows bent.
5. Press the bar straight forward against the band’s resistance until your arms are fully extended.
6. Slowly bring the bar back to chest level under control, then repeat for the desired reps.

Stand facing away in a staggered stance, holding the bar at chest level. Press the bar straight forward until your arms are extended, then return slowly to your chest. Repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Sit on the chest fly machine and adjust the seat height so the handles are level with the middle of your chest.
2. Place your feet flat on the floor and press your back firmly against the pad.
3. Grasp the handles with your palms facing forward or inward, elbows slightly bent.
4. Bring the handles together in a wide arc in front of your chest, squeezing your chest muscles at the midpoint.
5. Slowly return to the starting position under control, keeping the slight bend in your elbows throughout. Repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Sit on the chest fly machine with the handles at chest level. Keep your feet flat and back against the pad. With elbows slightly bent, bring the handles together in front of your chest and squeeze. Return slowly to the start, keeping that bend in your elbows, and repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Adjust the TRX straps to mid-length and stand facing away from the anchor point, holding one handle in each hand.
2. Step forward to create tension in the straps, keeping your body in a straight line from head to heels.
3. Position your feet either together or in a staggered stance for balance.
4. Bend your elbows at a slight angle and lower your chest toward your hands in a controlled motion.
5. Press through the handles to straighten your arms and return to the starting position, then repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Hold the TRX handles and face away from the anchor. Step forward to create tension and keep your body straight from head to heels. Lower your chest by bending your elbows, then press back to the start. Repeat.

Variations: Close-grip incline smith machine bench press
Exercise Description:
1. Position a flat bench under the Smith machine bar and lie on your back with your feet flat on the floor.
2. Grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width and unrack it by rotating the bar hooks.
3. Start with the bar held above your chest, arms extended.
4. Lower the bar in a controlled motion until it lightly touches the middle of your chest, keeping your elbows at a slight angle (not flared fully to the sides).
5. Press the bar upward until your arms are fully extended, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Lie on a flat bench under the Smith bar with your feet on the floor. Grip the bar wider than shoulder-width and unrack it. Lower the bar in control to your chest, then press it back up until your arms are straight. Repeat.

2. Grip the bar about shoulder-width apart or slightly closer, and unrack it by rotating the bar hooks.
3. Start with the bar held above your chest, arms extended.
4. Lower the bar in a controlled motion to your mid chest, keeping your elbows close to your torso.
5. Press the bar upward until your arms are fully extended, then repeat for the desired reps.

3. Unrack the bar by rotating the hooks and hold it above your upper chest with arms extended.
4. Lower the bar in a controlled motion to lightly touch your upper chest, keeping your elbows at a slight angle.
5. Press the bar upward until your arms are fully extended, then repeat for the desired reps.

Unrack it and hold it above your upper chest. Lower the bar in control to your chest, then press back up until your arms are straight. Repeat.

4. Lower the bar in a controlled motion to your upper chest, keeping your elbows close to your torso.

Exercise Description:
1. Lie flat on the chest press machine bench and adjust the seat so the handles line up with the middle of your chest.
2. Place your feet flat on the floor or foot platform for stability.
3. Grip the handles with your palms facing forward and elbows bent at about 90°.
4. Press the handles upward until your arms are fully extended without locking your elbows.
5. Slowly lower the handles back to the starting position in control, then repeat for the desired reps.

3. Grip the handles with your palms facing forward and elbows bent at about 90°.
4. Press the handles upward until your arms are fully extended without locking your elbows.
5. Slowly lower the handles back down under control, then repeat for the desired reps.

Exercise Description:

Exercise Description:

2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand above your chest with palms facing each other and elbows slightly bent.
3. Slowly lower the dumbbells out to the sides in a wide arc until your upper arms lightly touch the floor.
4. Bring the dumbbells back together above your chest, maintaining the slight bend in your elbows.
5. Repeat for the desired reps, keeping the motion slow and controlled.

Exercise Description:

2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand above your chest with palms facing each other and elbows slightly bent.
3. Slowly lower the dumbbells out to the sides in a wide arc until they are at chest level or slightly below, keeping the slight bend in your elbows.
4. Bring the dumbbells back together above your chest in the same wide arc, squeezing your chest muscles at the top.

5. Repeat for the desired reps with slow, controlled motion.

Exercise Description:

4. Keep your elbows at a slight angle (not flared fully to the sides).

3. Unrack the bar and hold it above your upper chest with arms extended.
4. Lower the bar into the cambered section in a controlled motion until you feel a deep stretch across your chest, keeping elbows at a slight angle.
5. Press the bar upward until your arms are fully extended, then repeat for the desired reps.

Exercise Description:

4. Slowly return the band to the starting position under control.
5. Complete the desired reps on one side, then switch and repeat with the other arm.

Variations: Standing leaning forward dumbbell lateral raise
Exercise Description:
1. Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides with palms facing inward.
2. Keep a slight bend in your elbows and your core engaged.
3. Raise both dumbbells out to the sides until they reach shoulder height, keeping palms facing downward and elbows leading the movement.
4. Pause briefly at the top, then slowly lower the dumbbells back to your sides under control.
5. Repeat for the desired reps, avoiding swinging or shrugging your shoulders.
Audio Script: Stand with feet hip-width apart and dumbbells at your sides. Keep a slight bend in your elbows and raise the dumbbells out to shoulder height with palms down. Lower slowly to your sides and repeat.

Variations: Standing leaning forward band lateral raise
Exercise Description:
1. Attach a single-grip handle to each end of a loop band and place the middle of the band under one foot in a staggered stance.
2. Hold a handle in each hand at your sides with palms facing inward, elbows slightly bent, and core engaged.
3. Raise both handles out to the sides until they reach shoulder height, leading with your elbows and keeping palms facing downward.
4. Slowly lower the handles back to your sides under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, keeping your torso still and avoiding swinging.
Audio Script: Stand in a staggered stance with one foot on the band and a handle in each hand at your sides. Keep a slight bend in your elbows and raise the handles out to shoulder height with palms down. Lower slowly to your sides and repeat.

Variations: Standing leaning forward Handle band lateral raise
bent over Handle band lateral raise
Exercise Description:
1. Stand in the middle of a handled resistance band with your feet hip-width apart or in a staggered stance.
2. Hold a handle in each hand at your sides with palms facing inward, elbows slightly bent, and core braced.
3. Raise both handles out to the sides until they reach shoulder height, leading with your elbows and keeping palms facing downward.
4. Pause briefly at the top, then slowly lower the handles back to your sides under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, keeping your torso still and avoiding swinging or shrugging.
Audio Script: Stand on the middle of a handled band with a handle in each hand at your sides. Keep a slight bend in your elbows and raise the handles out to shoulder height with palms down. Lower slowly to your sides and repeat.

Exercise: Standing leaning forward dumbbell lateral raise
Exercise Description:
1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides, palms facing inward.
2. Hinge forward slightly at the hips so your torso leans forward while keeping your back straight and core engaged.
3. With elbows slightly bent, raise both dumbbells out to the sides until they reach shoulder height.
4. Pause briefly at the top, then slowly lower the dumbbells back down under control.
5. Repeat for the desired reps, avoiding swinging or shrugging your shoulders.
Audio Script: Stand with dumbbells at your sides and hinge slightly forward at the hips. With elbows bent, raise the dumbbells out to shoulder height, then lower them slowly. Repeat.

Exercise: Standing leaning forward band lateral raise
Exercise Description:
1. Attach a single-grip handle to each end of one loop band and place the middle of the band under one foot in a staggered stance.
2. Hold a handle in each hand at your sides with palms facing inward and hinge slightly forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and core engaged.
3. With elbows slightly bent, raise both handles out to the sides until they reach shoulder height.
4. Pause briefly at the top, then slowly lower the handles back to the starting position under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, avoiding swinging or shrugging.
Audio Script: Stand in a staggered stance with the band under one foot and a handle in each hand. Hinge forward at the hips. With elbows bent, raise the handles out to shoulder height, then lower slowly. Repeat.

Exercise: Standing leaning forward Handle band lateral raise
Variations: bent over Handle band lateral raise
Exercise Description:
1. Stand on the middle of a handled resistance band with your feet hip-width apart or in a staggered stance.
2. Hold a handle in each hand at your sides with palms facing inward and hinge slightly forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and core engaged.
3. With elbows slightly bent, raise both handles out to the sides until they reach shoulder height.
4. Pause briefly at the top, then slowly lower the handles back to the starting position under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, avoiding swinging or shrugging.
Audio Script: Stand on the middle of a handled band with a handle in each hand. Hinge forward at the hips and keep your back straight. With elbows bent, raise the handles out to shoulder height, then lower slowly. Repeat.

Animation name: Shoulders/bent over rear delt fly dumbbell
Variations: Standing leaning forward dumbbell lateral raise
Exercise Description:
1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at arm’s length with palms facing each other.
2. Hinge forward at the hips until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor, keeping your back straight and core engaged.
3. Let the dumbbells hang below your shoulders with elbows slightly bent.
4. Raise both dumbbells out to the sides until they reach shoulder height, squeezing your rear delts at the top.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Hinge forward at the hips until your torso is almost parallel to the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing each other. With elbows slightly bent, raise the dumbbells out to shoulder height, then lower them slowly. Repeat.

Animation name: Shoulders/bent over rear deltoid fly resistance band
Prerequesite Exercise: Standing leaning forward band lateral raise
Variations: Standing leaning forward band lateral raise
Exercise Description:
1. Attach a single-grip handle to each end of one loop band and place the middle of the band under one foot in a staggered stance.
2. Hold a handle in each hand with palms facing each other and hinge forward at the hips until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor.
3. Let the handles hang below your shoulders with elbows slightly bent.
4. Raise both handles out to the sides until they reach shoulder height, squeezing your rear delts at the top.
5. Slowly lower the handles back down under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Stand in a staggered stance with the band under one foot and hinge forward until your torso is almost parallel to the floor. Hold a handle in each hand with palms facing each other. With elbows bent, raise the handles out to shoulder height, then lower slowly. Repeat.

Exercise: Bent over Handle band lateral raise
Animation name: Shoulders/bent over rear deltoid fly resistance band
Prerequesite Exercise: Standing leaning forward Handle band lateral raise
Variations: Standing leaning forward Handle band lateral raise
Exercise Description:
1. Stand on the middle of a handled resistance band with your feet hip-width apart or in a staggered stance.
2. Hold a handle in each hand with palms facing each other and hinge forward at the hips until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor, keeping your back straight and core engaged.
3. Let the handles hang below your shoulders with elbows slightly bent.
4. Raise both handles out to the sides until they reach shoulder height, squeezing your rear delts at the top.
5. Slowly lower the handles back down under control and repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Stand on the middle of a handled band and hinge forward until your torso is almost parallel to the floor. Hold a handle in each hand with palms facing each other. With elbows bent, raise the handles out to shoulder height, then lower slowly. Repeat.

Variations: Standing leaning forward dumbbell lateral raise
Exercise Description:
1. Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides with palms facing inward.
2. Keep a slight bend in your elbows and raise the dumbbells out to the sides in an arc, continuing past shoulder height until they meet overhead.
3. At the top, your arms should be almost straight with the backs of your palms facing each other.
4. Slowly lower the dumbbells along the same path back to your sides under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, avoiding swinging or leaning back.
Audio Script: Stand with dumbbells at your sides and a slight bend in your elbows. Raise them out to the sides and keep going until the dumbbells meet overhead, with the backs of your palms facing each other. Lower slowly to your sides and repeat.

Variations: Standing leaning forward dumbbell lateral raise
Exercise Description:
1. Stand beside a sturdy support (rack, cable post, or wall) and hold it with your non-working hand.
2. Hold a dumbbell in the opposite hand at your side with palm facing inward, then lean your torso slightly toward the support.
3. With a slight bend in your elbow, raise the dumbbell out to the side until it reaches shoulder height or overhead.
4. Slowly lower the dumbbell back to your side under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps on one arm, then switch sides.
Audio Script: Stand beside a support and hold it with one hand. Lean your torso slightly toward the support while holding a dumbbell at your side. With a bend in your elbow, raise the dumbbell to shoulder height or overhead, then lower slowly. Switch sides.

Variations: Standing leaning forward dumbbell lateral raise
Exercise Description:
1. Stand beside a sturdy support and hold it with your non-working hand.
2. Hold a dumbbell in the opposite hand at your side with palm facing inward, positioning your feet closer to the support so your torso leans away.
3. From this stretched position, raise the dumbbell out to the side until it reaches shoulder height or slightly higher.
4. Lower the dumbbell slowly back to the starting position under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps on one arm, then switch sides.
Audio Script: Stand beside a support and hold it with one hand. Lean your torso away from the support while holding a dumbbell at your side. With a bend in your elbow, raise the dumbbell to shoulder height, then lower slowly. Switch sides.

Exercise Description:
1. Set a cable pulley to the lowest setting and attach a single-grip handle. Stand sideways to the machine with the working shoulder farthest from the pulley.
2. Grab the handle with the outside hand, palm facing inward, and keep a slight bend in your elbow.
3. Brace your core and keep your torso still as you raise your arm out to the side in a wide arc until it reaches shoulder height.
4. Pause briefly at the top, then slowly lower the handle back to your side under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps on one arm, then switch sides.
Audio Script: Stand sideways to the cable with the pulley low. Hold the handle in the outside hand at your side. With a slight bend in your elbow, raise your arm out to shoulder height, then lower slowly. Switch sides.

Animation name: Shoulders/Cable Bent Over One Arm Lateral Raise
Prerequesite Exercise: Standing leaning forward dumbbell lateral raise
Regression: Standing leaning forward dumbbell lateral raise
Exercise Description:
1. Set a cable pulley to the lowest setting and attach a single-grip handle. Stand sideways to the machine with the working shoulder farthest from the pulley.
2. Hold the handle with the outside hand, palm facing inward, and step slightly away from the machine.
3. Hinge forward at the hips so your torso leans toward the floor while keeping your back straight and core engaged.
4. With a slight bend in your elbow, raise your arm out to the side in a wide arc until it reaches shoulder height.
5. Slowly lower the handle back to the starting position under control and repeat for the desired reps before switching sides.
Audio Script: Set the pulley low and stand sideways to the machine. Hold the handle in the outside hand and hinge forward at the hips. With a bend in your elbow, raise your arm to shoulder height, then lower slowly. Switch sides.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand inside the lateral raise machine and grasp the handles or bars attached to the lever arms with palms facing inward.
2. Keep your torso upright, core braced, and elbows slightly bent.
3. Raise the handles outward in a wide arc until your arms reach shoulder height.
4. Pause briefly at the top, squeezing your shoulders.
5. Slowly lower the handles back to the starting position under control and repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Stand in the machine and hold the handles with palms in. With elbows slightly bent, raise the handles out to shoulder height, pause, then lower slowly. Repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Sit on the lateral raise machine with your back against the pad and feet flat on the floor. Adjust the seat height so the pads rest comfortably against the outside of your upper arms just above the elbows.
2. Grip the handles lightly if available, keeping your torso upright and core braced.
3. Push your arms outward against the pads, raising them in a wide arc until they reach shoulder height.
4. Pause briefly at the top, squeezing your shoulders.
5. Slowly return the arms to the starting position under control and repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Sit on the lateral raise machine with the pads against your upper arms. Keep your torso upright and push your arms out to shoulder height, pause, then lower slowly. Repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart, holding a barbell in front of your thighs with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Keep your torso upright, core braced, and elbows slightly bent.
3. Raise the barbell straight up in front of you until it reaches shoulder height.
4. Pause briefly at the top, then slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, avoiding swinging or leaning back.
Audio Script: Stand tall with a barbell in front of your thighs, palms down. With elbows slightly bent, raise the bar to shoulder height, pause, then lower slowly. Repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand in front of your thighs with palms facing your body.
2. Keep your torso upright, core braced, and elbows slightly bent.
3. Raise one dumbbell straight up in front of you until it reaches shoulder height while keeping the other arm at your side.
4. Slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position under control as you prepare to lift the opposite arm.
5. Continue alternating arms for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Stand tall with a dumbbell in each hand. Raise one dumbbell to shoulder height, then lower it as you lift the other. Keep your core tight and alternate reps.

Exercise Description:
1. Sit tall on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides with palms facing inward toward your body.
2. Keep your back straight, core engaged, and elbows slightly bent.
3. Raise one dumbbell forward and upward to shoulder height while rotating your wrist so your palm faces downward at the top.
4. Slowly lower the dumbbell back to your side under control as you prepare to lift the opposite arm.
5. Continue alternating arms for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Sit tall with dumbbells at your sides, palms in. Raise one dumbbell forward to shoulder height while rotating your wrist so the palm faces down, then lower slowly. Alternate arms for reps.

Exercise Description:
1. Attach a single-grip handle to each end of one loop band and place the middle of the band under one foot in a staggered stance.
2. Hold a handle in each hand in front of your thighs with palms facing your body, elbows slightly bent, and core engaged.
3. Raise both handles straight forward and upward until they reach shoulder height, keeping arms straight but not locked.
4. Pause briefly at the top, then slowly lower the handles back to the starting position under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, avoiding swinging or leaning back.
Audio Script: Stand in a staggered stance with the band under one foot and a handle in each hand in front of your thighs. Raise both handles forward to shoulder height, pause, then lower slowly. Repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand on the middle of a handled resistance band with your feet hip-width apart or in a staggered stance.
2. Hold a handle in each hand in front of your thighs with palms facing your body, elbows slightly bent, and core engaged.
3. Raise both handles straight forward and upward until they reach shoulder height, keeping arms straight but not locked.
4. Pause briefly at the top, then slowly lower the handles back to the starting position under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, avoiding swinging or leaning back.
Audio Script: Stand on the middle of a handled band with a handle in each hand in front of your thighs. Raise both handles forward to shoulder height, pause, then lower slowly. Repeat.

Animation name: Shoulders/Dumbbell Incline One Arm Lateral Raise
Variations: Standing leaning forward dumbbell lateral raise
Exercise Description:
1. Lie on your side on a flat bench or the floor, holding a dumbbell in your top hand with your arm extended straight down toward the floor, palm facing your body.
2. Keep your lower arm relaxed along your torso and brace your core.
3. With a slight bend in your elbow, raise the dumbbell upward in an arc until your arm is vertical above your shoulder.
4. Pause briefly at the top, then slowly lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps on one side, then switch and perform on the other side.
Audio Script: Lie on your side with a dumbbell in the top hand. With a slight bend in your elbow, raise the dumbbell upward until your arm is vertical, then lower slowly. Repeat, then switch sides.

Variations: Standing leaning forward dumbbell lateral raise
Exercise Description:
1. Lie face down on a flat or incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand, arms hanging straight down below your shoulders, palms facing each other.
2. Keep your chest supported on the bench, core engaged, and elbows slightly bent.
3. Raise both dumbbells out to the sides in a wide arc until they reach shoulder height.
4. Pause briefly at the top, squeezing your rear delts.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down under control and repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Lie face down on a bench with dumbbells hanging below your shoulders. With elbows slightly bent, raise the dumbbells to shoulder height, squeeze, then lower slowly. Repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Set a cable pulley to the lowest setting and attach a single-grip handle. Stand sideways to the machine with the working shoulder farthest from the pulley.
2. Hold the handle in the outside hand with palm facing inward, arm resting across the front of your body.
3. With a slight bend in your elbow, raise the handle upward and outward at about a 45° angle until your arm forms a “Y” shape with your torso.
4. Pause briefly at the top, squeezing your shoulder.
5. Slowly lower the handle back to the starting position under control and repeat for the desired reps before switching sides.
Audio Script: Stand sideways to the cable with the pulley low. Hold the handle in the outside hand and raise it upward and outward at a 45-degree angle into a Y-shape. Pause, then lower slowly. Switch sides.

Exercise Description:
1. Sit facing the pec deck machine with your chest against the pad, feet flat on the floor, and grasp the handles or place your forearms against the pads.
2. Start with your arms extended forward at shoulder height, elbows slightly bent.
3. Pull the handles or pads outward and backward in a wide arc until your arms are extended to your sides.
4. Pause briefly at the end of the movement, squeezing your rear delts and upper back.
5. Slowly return to the starting position under control and repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Sit facing the pec deck with your chest on the pad. Grab the handles and pull your arms back in a wide arc until they’re out to your sides, squeeze, then return slowly. Repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell at shoulder level with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.
2. Keep your chest up, core braced, and elbows slightly in front of the bar.
3. Press the barbell upward in a slight arc, guiding it forward just enough to avoid your face.
4. At the top, lock out your arms with the barbell directly over the middle of your head.
5. Slowly lower the bar back to shoulder level under control and repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Stand tall with a barbell at shoulder height, palms forward. Brace your core and press the bar upward in a slight arc to avoid your face, finishing above the middle of your head. Lower slowly and repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Sit on a bench with an upright back support and place your feet flat on the floor. Hold a barbell at shoulder level with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.
2. Keep your chest up, core braced, and elbows slightly in front of the bar.
3. Press the barbell upward in a slight arc, guiding it forward just enough to avoid your face.
4. At the top, lock out your arms with the barbell directly over the middle of your head.
5. Slowly lower the bar back to shoulder level under control and repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Sit upright with a barbell at shoulder height, palms forward. Brace your core and press the bar upward in a slight arc to avoid your face, finishing above the middle of your head. Lower slowly and repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Sit on the floor with your legs extended straight in front of you in an “L” position, feet together and torso upright. Hold a barbell at shoulder level with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.
2. Keep your chest up, core braced, and elbows slightly in front of the bar.
3. Press the barbell upward in a slight arc, guiding it forward just enough to avoid your face.
4. At the top, lock out your arms with the barbell directly above the middle of your head while keeping your torso tall.
5. Slowly lower the bar back to shoulder level under control and repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Sit on the floor with legs straight in front of you and a barbell at shoulder height. Brace your core and press the bar upward in a slight arc to avoid your face, finishing above the middle of your head. Lower slowly and repeat.

Animation name: Shoulders/behind neck press resistance band cable
Exercise Description:
1. Stand on the bottom of a loop band with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding the top of the band in each hand.
2. Bring your hands up to shoulder height with palms facing forward, elbows bent, and core braced.
3. Press the band upward in a slight arc until your arms are fully extended overhead.
4. At the top, keep your arms straight but not locked, with the band directly above your head.
5. Slowly lower your hands back to shoulder height under control and repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Stand on a loop band and hold the top in each hand at shoulder height. Press upward until your arms are extended overhead, then lower slowly. Repeat

Variations: Standing single arm dumbbell shoulder press
Standing neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
L-sit single arm dumbbell shoulder press
Seated neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
Progression: Standing single arm dumbbell shoulder press
Exercise Description:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height with palms facing forward.
2. Keep your chest up, core braced, and elbows slightly in front of your torso in a comfortable pressing position.
3. Press the dumbbells straight upward until your arms are extended overhead.
4. At the top, keep the dumbbells above your head with arms straight, avoiding forceful elbow lockout.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to shoulder height under control and repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Stand tall with dumbbells at shoulder height, palms forward. Press the dumbbells straight overhead until your arms are extended, then lower slowly. Repeat.

Exercise: Standing single arm dumbbell shoulder press
Variations: Standing neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
L-sit single arm dumbbell shoulder press
Seated neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
Exercise Description:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in one hand at shoulder height with your palm facing forward.
2. Place your free hand on your hip or keep it out for balance, brace your core, and keep your torso upright.
3. Press the dumbbell straight upward until your arm is extended overhead.
4. At the top, keep the dumbbell above your head with your arm straight, avoiding forceful elbow lockout.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbell back to shoulder height under control and repeat for the desired reps before switching sides.
Audio Script: Stand tall with a dumbbell at shoulder height in one hand. Brace your core and press the dumbbell overhead until your arm is extended, then lower slowly. Repeat and switch sides.

Exercise: Standing neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
Variations: Standing single arm dumbbell shoulder press
L-sit single arm dumbbell shoulder press
Seated neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
Regression: Seated neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
Exercise Description:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height with palms facing each other.
2. Keep your chest up, core braced, and elbows close to your sides in a comfortable pressing position.
3. Press the dumbbells straight upward until your arms are extended overhead.
4. At the top, keep the dumbbells above your head with arms straight, avoiding forceful elbow lockout.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to shoulder height under control and repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Stand tall with dumbbells at shoulder height, palms facing each other. Press the dumbbells overhead until your arms are extended, then lower slowly. Repeat.

Variations: Standing single arm dumbbell shoulder press
Standing neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
L-sit single arm dumbbell shoulder press
Seated neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
Exercise Description:
1. Sit upright on a bench with a back support, feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height with palms facing forward.
2. Keep your chest up, core braced, and elbows slightly in front of your torso in a comfortable pressing position.
3. Press the dumbbells straight upward until your arms are extended overhead.
4. At the top, keep the dumbbells above your head with arms straight, avoiding forceful elbow lockout.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to shoulder height under control and repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Sit upright with dumbbells at shoulder height, palms forward. Press the dumbbells overhead until your arms are extended, then lower slowly. Repeat.

Exercise: Seated neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
Animation name: Shoulders/dumbbell seated shoulder press parallel grip
Variations: Standing single arm dumbbell shoulder press
Standing neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
L-sit single arm dumbbell shoulder press
Progression: Standing neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
Exercise Description:

2. Keep your chest up, core braced, and elbows close to your sides in a comfortable pressing position.
3. Press the dumbbells straight upward until your arms are extended overhead.
4. At the top, keep the dumbbells above your head with arms straight, avoiding forceful elbow lockout.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to shoulder height under control and repeat for the desired reps.

Variations: Standing single arm dumbbell shoulder press
Standing neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
L-sit single arm dumbbell shoulder press
Seated neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
Progression: L-sit single arm dumbbell shoulder press
Exercise Description:
1. Sit on the floor with your legs extended straight in front of you in an “L” position, feet together and torso upright. Hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height with palms facing forward.
2. Keep your chest up, core braced, and elbows slightly in front of your torso.
3. Press the dumbbells straight upward until your arms are extended overhead.
4. At the top, keep the dumbbells directly above your head with arms straight, avoiding forceful elbow lockout.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to shoulder height under control and repeat for the desired reps.

Exercise: L-sit single arm dumbbell shoulder press
Variations: Standing single arm dumbbell shoulder press
Standing neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
Seated neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
Exercise Description:
1. Sit on the floor with your legs extended straight in front of you in an “L” position, feet together and torso upright. Hold a dumbbell in one hand at shoulder height with your palm facing forward.
2. Place your free hand on your thigh or out to the side for balance, keeping your chest up and core braced.
3. Press the dumbbell straight upward until your arm is extended overhead.
4. At the top, keep the dumbbell directly above your head with your arm straight, avoiding forceful elbow lockout.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbell back to shoulder height under control and repeat for the desired reps before switching sides.
Audio Script: Sit on the floor with your legs straight in front of you and a dumbbell at shoulder height in one hand. Press it overhead until your arm is extended, then lower slowly. Repeat, then switch sides.

Animation name: Shoulders/Iso Lateral Shoulder Press Both Arms
Exercise Description:
1. Sit on the machine with your back firmly against the pad and feet flat on the floor. Adjust the seat height so the handles are level with or just below your shoulders.
2. Grasp the handles with an overhand grip, palms facing forward, and keep your elbows bent.
3. Brace your core and press the handles upward until your arms are extended overhead.
4. At the top, keep the handles directly above your head with arms straight, avoiding forceful elbow lockout.
5. Slowly lower the handles back to shoulder level under control and repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Sit with your back against the pad and grasp the handles at shoulder height. Press the handles overhead until your arms are extended, then lower slowly. Repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand in front of your thighs with palms facing your body.
2. Keep your chest up, shoulders down, and core braced.
3. Pull the dumbbells upward along the front of your body by bending your elbows and leading with them, keeping the dumbbells close.
4. Raise the dumbbells until they reach chest level or slightly below shoulder height, keeping elbows higher than wrists.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position under control and repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Stand tall with dumbbells in front of your thighs, palms in. Lead with your elbows as you pull the dumbbells up to chest level, then lower slowly. Repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Set a cable pulley to the lowest setting and attach a rope handle. Stand tall facing the machine and grasp the rope with both hands, palms facing each other.
2. Keep your chest up, shoulders down, and core braced with the rope resting lightly against your thighs.
3. Pull the rope upward along the front of your body by bending your elbows and leading with them, keeping the rope close.
4. Raise the rope until your hands reach chest level or slightly below shoulder height, keeping elbows higher than wrists.
5. Slowly lower the rope back to the starting position under control and repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Stand facing a low cable with a rope attachment. Hold the rope with palms facing each other and pull upward to chest level, leading with your elbows. Lower slowly and repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Set both pulleys on a cable machine to the highest setting. Stand in the middle of the machine with your feet staggered for balance.
2. Grab the end of the left cable with your right hand and the end of the right cable with your left hand so the cables cross in front of you. Extend your arms forward at shoulder height with a slight bend in the elbows.
3. Pull the cables outward and backward in a wide arc until your arms are extended straight out to your sides.
4. Pause briefly at the end of the movement, squeezing your rear delts and upper back.
5. Slowly return your arms to the starting position under control and repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Stand between two high pulleys and grab the cable ends so they cross in front of you. With elbows slightly bent, pull the cables out and back until your arms are to your sides, squeeze, then return slowly. Repeat.

Variations: Standing rope face pulls with band
Exercise Description:
1. Attach a single-grip handle to each end of one loop band and anchor the band to a sturdy point at shoulder height.
2. Stand facing the anchor in a staggered stance for balance and grasp a handle in each hand, arms extended forward at shoulder height.
3. Brace your core, keep your chest up, and pull the handles back and outward by driving your elbows high and wide.
4. Squeeze your upper back and rear delts at the end of the movement.
5. Slowly return your arms to the starting position under control and repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Stand in a staggered stance facing the anchor with the band set at shoulder height. Hold a handle in each hand and pull your elbows back and out wide until your hands reach your upper chest, squeeze, then return slowly. Repeat.

Variations: Standing rope face pulls with band
Exercise Description:
1. Anchor the handled resistance band to a sturdy point at shoulder height.
2. Stand facing the anchor in a staggered stance and grasp a handle in each hand with arms extended forward at shoulder height.
3. Brace your core, keep your chest tall, and pull the handles back and outward by driving your elbows high and wide.
4. Squeeze your upper back and rear delts at the end of the movement.
5. Slowly return your arms to the starting position under control and repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Stand in a staggered stance facing the anchor with the band set at shoulder height. Hold the handles and pull your elbows back and wide until your hands reach your upper chest, squeeze, then return slowly. Repeat.

Variations: ['Standing banded high row', 'Handle band high row', ''Standing rope face pulls with band']
Exercise Description:
1. Attach a single-grip handle to each end of one loop band and anchor the band to a sturdy point at shoulder height.
2. Get into a half-kneeling stance facing the anchor, with one knee on the ground and the other foot planted forward for stability.
3. Hold a handle in each hand with arms extended forward at shoulder height, chest tall, and core braced.
4. Pull the handles back and outward by driving your elbows high and wide until your hands are near your upper chest.
5. Squeeze your upper back and rear delts, then slowly return to the starting position and repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Kneel on one knee facing the anchor with the band at shoulder height. Hold the handles with arms forward. Pull your elbows back and wide until your hands reach your upper chest, squeeze, then return slowly. Repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Set a cable pulley to about upper-chest or face height and attach a rope handle.
2. Stand facing the machine in a staggered stance, holding the rope with both hands, palms facing each other.
3. Brace your core, keep your chest tall, and start with your arms extended forward.
4. Pull the rope toward your face by driving your elbows back and flaring them outward, separating the rope as it nears your face.
5. Squeeze your rear delts and upper back, then slowly return your arms to the starting position under control and repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Stand facing a high pulley with a rope attachment. Hold the rope with palms facing each other and pull it toward your face, separating the ends as your elbows flare out. Squeeze, then return slowly. Repeat.

Exercise: Standing rope face pulls with band
Exercise Description:
1. Anchor a loop band to a sturdy point at about face height and attach a triceps rope to the band.
2. Stand facing the anchor in a staggered stance for balance and hold one end of the rope in each hand with palms facing each other.
3. Start with your arms extended forward, chest tall, and core braced.
4. Pull the rope toward your face by driving your elbows back and outward, separating the rope ends as they approach your face.
5. Squeeze your rear delts and upper back, then slowly return your arms to the starting position and repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Anchor a loop band with a rope at face height. Stand facing it and hold the rope with palms facing each other. Pull the rope toward your face, separating the ends as your elbows flare out. Squeeze, then return slowly. Repeat.

Variations: Double kettlebell squat to shoulder press
Exercise Description:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height with palms facing each other.
2. Brace your core, push your hips back, and lower into a squat until your thighs are about parallel to the floor.
3. Drive through your heels to stand up, using the upward momentum to begin pressing the dumbbells overhead.
4. At the top, extend your arms fully with the dumbbells directly above your head, then lower them back to shoulder height.
5. Flow smoothly into the next squat and repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Stand with dumbbells at shoulder height, palms facing each other. Squat down, then drive up and press the dumbbells overhead in one motion. Lower them back to your shoulders and repeat.

Variations: Double kettlebell squat to shoulder press
Exercise Description:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding the round body of the kettlebell with both hands at chest level. Place your thumbs where the handle meets the bell for support, palms facing each other.
2. Brace your core, push your hips back, and lower into a squat until your thighs are about parallel to the floor.
3. Drive through your heels to stand up, using the upward momentum to begin pressing the kettlebell overhead with both hands.
4. At the top, extend your arms fully with the kettlebell directly above your head, then lower it back to chest level.
5. Flow smoothly into the next squat and repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Hold the round part of the kettlebell with both hands at chest level, thumbs under the handle. Squat down, then drive up and press the kettlebell overhead. Lower it back to your chest and repeat.

Exercise: Double kettlebell squat to shoulder press
Exercise Description:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell in each hand in the racked position at shoulder height with palms facing inward and elbows tucked slightly in front of your body.
2. Brace your core, push your hips back, and lower into a squat until your thighs are about parallel to the floor.
3. Drive through your heels to stand up, using the upward momentum to begin pressing both kettlebells overhead.
4. At the top, extend your arms fully with the kettlebells directly above your head, then lower them back to the racked position at your shoulders.
5. Flow smoothly into the next squat and repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Hold two kettlebells in the racked position at your shoulders. Squat down, then drive up and press both kettlebells overhead. Lower them back to your shoulders and repeat.

Variations: Double kettlebell squat to shoulder press
Exercise Description:
1. Stand on the middle of a loop band with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the top of the band in both hands at shoulder height, palms facing forward.
2. Brace your core, push your hips back, and lower into a squat until your thighs are about parallel to the floor.
3. Drive through your heels to stand up, using the upward momentum to press the band overhead.
4. At the top, extend your arms fully with the band directly above your head, then lower your hands back to shoulder height.
5. Flow smoothly into the next squat and repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Stand on a loop band and hold it at shoulder height. Squat down, then drive up and press the band overhead. Lower back to your shoulders and repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Set the bar on a Smith machine to about upper-chest level and stand with your feet shoulder-width apart under the bar.
2. Grip the bar with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width, palms facing forward, and unrack it to shoulder height.
3. Brace your core, keep your chest tall, and press the bar upward along the guided track until your arms are extended overhead.
4. At the top, keep the bar directly above your head with arms straight, avoiding forceful elbow lockout.
5. Slowly lower the bar back to shoulder height under control and repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Stand under the Smith bar and unrack it at shoulder height. Press it overhead until your arms are extended, then lower slowly. Repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Place a bench with a back support under the Smith machine bar and adjust the bar to about upper-chest level.
2. Sit on the bench with your feet flat on the floor, grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width with palms facing forward, and unrack it to shoulder height.
3. Brace your core, keep your chest tall, and press the bar upward along the guided track until your arms are extended overhead.
4. At the top, keep the bar directly above your head with arms straight, avoiding forceful elbow lockout.
5. Slowly lower the bar back to shoulder height under control and repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Sit on a bench under the Smith bar and unrack it at shoulder height. Press the bar overhead until your arms are extended, then lower slowly. Repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Position the Smith machine bar at about upper-chest level. Sit on the floor under the bar with your legs extended straight in front of you in an “L” position, torso upright.
2. Grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width with palms facing forward and unrack it to shoulder height.
3. Brace your core and keep your back tall against the bar path.
4. Press the bar upward along the guided track until your arms are extended overhead, keeping it aligned above the middle of your head.
5. Slowly lower the bar back to shoulder height under control and repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Sit on the floor under the Smith bar with your legs straight in front of you. Unrack the bar at shoulder height and press it overhead until your arms are extended, then lower slowly. Repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding the round body of a kettlebell with both hands at chest level. Place your thumbs where the handle meets the bell for support, palms facing each other.
2. Brace your core and keep your chest upright.
3. Press the kettlebell overhead in a smooth motion until your arms are extended.
4. At the top, keep the kettlebell directly above your head with arms straight, avoiding forceful elbow lockout.
5. Slowly lower the kettlebell back to chest level under control and repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Hold the round part of the kettlebell with both hands at chest level, thumbs under the handle. Press it overhead until your arms are extended, then lower slowly. Repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell in each hand in the racked position at shoulder height, palms facing inward and the bells resting against your forearms.
2. Brace your core, keep your chest tall, and position your elbows slightly in front of your torso.
3. Press both kettlebells overhead in a smooth motion, allowing your palms to rotate forward naturally as you press.
4. At the top, keep the kettlebells directly above your head with arms straight, avoiding forceful elbow lockout.
5. Slowly lower the kettlebells back to the racked position at shoulder height and repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Hold two kettlebells in the racked position at shoulder height. Brace your core and press them overhead until your arms are extended, then lower slowly. Repeat.

Animation name: Shoulders/Kettlebell Standing Bottoms-up One Arm Shoulder Press
Exercise Description:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell upside down in one hand so the round bell is above the handle. Keep it at shoulder height with your palm facing inward and wrist straight.
2. Brace your core, keep your chest tall, and stabilize the kettlebell in the bottoms-up position.
3. Press the kettlebell slowly overhead, keeping it balanced directly above your wrist.
4. At the top, extend your arm fully with the kettlebell directly above your head, avoiding forceful elbow lockout.
5. Slowly lower the kettlebell back to shoulder height under control and repeat for the desired reps before switching sides.
Audio Script: Hold a kettlebell upside down at shoulder height, palm in. Brace your core and press it slowly overhead while keeping it balanced, then lower with control. Repeat, then switch sides.

Variations: EZ curl bar floor skull crushers
Exercise Description:
1. Lie on your back on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor, holding an EZ curl bar with a close overhand grip. Position the bar above your chest with arms extended.
2. Keep your upper arms fixed and elbows pointing upward throughout the movement.
3. Bend your elbows to slowly lower the bar toward your forehead in a controlled motion.
4. Stop just short of touching your forehead, then press the bar back up by extending your elbows.
5. Fully straighten your arms at the top, avoiding elbow lockout, and repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Lie on a bench holding an EZ curl bar above your chest. Bend your elbows to lower the bar toward your forehead, then extend your arms to press it back up. Repeat.

Exercise: EZ curl bar floor skull crushers
Exercise Description:
1. Lie on your back on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat, holding an EZ curl bar with a close overhand grip. Position the bar above your chest with arms extended.
2. Keep your upper arms fixed and elbows pointing upward throughout the movement.
3. Bend your elbows to slowly lower the bar toward your forehead in a controlled motion.
4. Allow your upper arms to lightly touch the floor as a natural stopping point.
5. Press the bar back up by extending your elbows until your arms are straight, then repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Lie on the floor holding an EZ curl bar above your chest. Lower the bar toward your forehead until your arms touch the floor, then press it back up. Repeat.

Variations: EZ curl bar floor skull crushers
Exercise Description:
1. Lie on your back on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand above your chest with palms facing each other.
2. Keep your upper arms fixed and elbows pointing upward throughout the movement.
3. Bend your elbows to slowly lower the dumbbells toward the sides of your head in a controlled motion.
4. Stop just short of touching your head, then extend your elbows to press the dumbbells back up.
5. Fully straighten your arms at the top, avoiding forceful lockout, and repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Lie on a bench holding dumbbells above your chest, palms facing each other. Bend your elbows to lower the dumbbells toward your head, then extend your arms to press them back up. Repeat.

Variations: EZ curl bar floor skull crushers
Regression: EZ curl bar floor skull crushers
Exercise Description:
1. Lie on your back on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat, holding a dumbbell in each hand above your chest with palms facing each other.
2. Keep your upper arms fixed and elbows pointing upward throughout the movement.
3. Bend your elbows to slowly lower the dumbbells toward the sides of your head in a controlled motion.
4. Allow your upper arms to lightly touch the floor as a natural stopping point.
5. Extend your elbows to press the dumbbells back up until your arms are straight, then repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Lie on the floor holding dumbbells above your chest, palms facing each other. Lower them toward your head until your arms touch the floor, then extend back up. Repeat.

Exercise: Standing EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension
Variations: Standing single arm overhead triceps extension
Seated EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension
Seated single arm overhead triceps extension
Regression: Seated EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension
Exercise Description:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding an EZ curl bar with a close overhand grip. Press the bar overhead until your arms are fully extended.
2. Keep your upper arms close to your head, elbows pointing forward, and core braced.
3. Bend your elbows to slowly lower the bar behind your head in a controlled arc.
4. Stop when you feel a stretch in your triceps, then press the bar back up by extending your elbows.
5. Fully extend your arms overhead without forcefully locking out, then repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Stand tall with an EZ curl bar held overhead. Lower the bar behind your head by bending your elbows, then press it back up until your arms are extended. Repeat.

Standing single arm overhead triceps extension
Seated EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension
Seated single arm overhead triceps extension
Exercise Description:

2. Keep your upper arms close to your head, elbows pointing forward, and core braced.
3. Bend your elbows to slowly lower the plate behind your head in a controlled arc.
4. Stop when you feel a stretch in your triceps, then extend your elbows to press the plate back overhead.
5. Fully extend your arms without forcefully locking out, then repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Stand tall holding a weight plate overhead. Lower it behind your head by bending your elbows, then press it back up until your arms are extended. Repeat.

Standing single arm overhead triceps extension
Seated EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension

Exercise Description:

2. Keep your upper arms close to your head, elbows pointing forward, and brace your core.
3. Bend your elbows to slowly lower the kettlebell behind your head in a controlled arc.
4. Stop when you feel a stretch in your triceps, then extend your elbows to press the kettlebell back overhead.
5. Fully extend your arms without forcefully locking out, then repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Hold the round part of the kettlebell with both hands and press it overhead. Lower it behind your head by bending your elbows, then press it back up until your arms are extended. Repeat.

Seated single arm overhead triceps extension
Exercise Description:

2. Keep your upper arms close to your head, elbows pointing forward, and core braced.

5. Fully extend your arms without forcefully locking out, then repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Stand tall holding two dumbbells overhead, palms facing each other. Lower them behind your head by bending your elbows, then press them back up until your arms are extended. Repeat.

Variations: Standing EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension

Seated single arm overhead triceps extension

Exercise Description:
1. Step onto the assisted dip machine platform and select the desired assistance weight. More weight provides more support.
2. Grasp the dip bars with your hands placed close together, directly under your shoulders.
3. Place your knees (or feet, depending on the machine design) on the assistance pad and press yourself up to the starting position with arms straight.
4. Lean your torso slightly forward, keep your shoulders down, and bend your elbows close to your body as you lower until your upper arms are about parallel to the floor.
5. Press through your hands to return to the starting position, maintaining elbows close throughout, then repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Step onto the assisted dip machine and grip the bars close together. Lower your body with elbows tight to your sides, then press back up to straight arms. Repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Grasp parallel dip bars with your hands placed close together, directly under your shoulders, and press yourself up to the starting position with arms straight.
2. Cross your ankles behind you or keep your legs straight, lean your torso slightly forward, and keep your shoulders down.
3. Bend your elbows close to your torso and lower your body in a controlled motion until your upper arms are about parallel to the floor.
4. Press through your hands to straighten your arms and return to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired reps, keeping elbows close throughout the movement.
Audio Script: Grip the dip bars close together and press up to straight arms. Lower your body with elbows tight to your sides, then press back up. Repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Secure a dip belt around your waist and attach a weight plate or dumbbell so it hangs between your legs.
2. Grasp parallel dip bars with your hands placed close together, directly under your shoulders, and press yourself up to the starting position with arms straight.
3. Cross your ankles behind you or keep your legs straight, lean your torso slightly forward, and keep your shoulders down.
4. Bend your elbows close to your torso and lower your body in a controlled motion until your upper arms are about parallel to the floor.
5. Press through your hands to straighten your arms and return to the starting position, then repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Secure a dip belt with weight and grip the bars close together. Lower your body with elbows tight to your sides, then press back up to straight arms. Repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Sit on the edge of a sturdy bench with your hands placed next to your hips, fingers pointing forward.
2. Walk your feet forward and extend your legs, keeping your heels on the floor and arms straight to support your weight.
3. Lower your body by bending your elbows straight back until your upper arms are about parallel to the floor.
4. Press through your palms to straighten your arms and lift your body back up.
5. Repeat for the desired reps, keeping your shoulders down and movement controlled.
Audio Script: Place your hands on the edge of a bench and extend your legs forward. Lower your body by bending your elbows, then press back up to straight arms. Repeat.

Variations: Single arm dumbbell triceps kickback on bench
Static bird dog with triceps extension
Regression: Single arm dumbbell triceps kickback on bench
Exercise Description:
1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing your body and stand with your feet hip-width apart. Hinge forward slightly at the hips, keeping your back straight and core engaged.
2. Bend your elbows to bring the dumbbells to your sides so your upper arms are parallel to the floor.
3. Keeping your upper arms still, extend your elbows to press the dumbbells straight back until your arms are fully extended.
4. Squeeze your triceps briefly at the top of the movement.
5. Slowly bend your elbows to return the dumbbells to the starting position and repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Hinge forward holding dumbbells with elbows bent at your sides. Extend your arms straight back, squeeze your triceps, then return slowly. Repeat.

Variations: Single arm dumbbell triceps kickback on bench
Static bird dog with triceps extension
Exercise Description:
1. Set an incline bench to about 30–45° and lie chest-down with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing your body.
2. Let the dumbbells hang straight down, then bend your elbows to bring them to your sides so your upper arms are parallel to the floor.
3. Keeping your upper arms still, extend your elbows to press the dumbbells straight back until your arms are fully extended.
4. Squeeze your triceps briefly at the top of the movement.
5. Slowly bend your elbows to return the dumbbells to the starting position and repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Lie chest-down on an incline bench with dumbbells hanging down. Bend your elbows, then extend your arms straight back, squeeze your triceps, and return slowly. Repeat.

Variations: Single arm dumbbell triceps kickback on bench
Static bird dog with triceps extension
Exercise Description:
1. Set a cable pulley to the lowest setting and stand facing the machine, holding the end of the cable directly in your hand (no attachment).
2. Step back and hinge slightly at the hips, keeping your back straight and core engaged.
3. Bend your elbow to bring your upper arm parallel to the floor, close to your torso.
4. Keeping your upper arm still, extend your elbow to press the cable straight back until your arm is fully extended.
5. Slowly bend your elbow to return to the starting position and repeat for the desired reps before switching sides.
Audio Script: Hold the end of a low cable and hinge forward slightly. With your elbow by your side, extend your arm straight back, squeeze your triceps, then return slowly. Repeat and switch sides.

Exercise: Single arm dumbbell triceps kickback on bench
Variations: Static bird dog with triceps extension
Exercise Description:
1. Place your left hand and left knee on a flat bench for support, holding a dumbbell in your right hand with your palm facing your body.
2. Keep your back flat, core engaged, and let the dumbbell hang straight down from your shoulder.
3. Bend your right elbow to bring the dumbbell up so your upper arm is parallel to the floor and close to your torso.
4. Keeping your upper arm still, extend your elbow to press the dumbbell straight back until your arm is fully extended.
5. Slowly bend your elbow to return to the starting position and repeat for the desired reps before switching sides.
Audio Script: Place one hand and knee on a bench for support, holding a dumbbell in the other hand. Bring your elbow up, then extend your arm straight back, squeeze your triceps, and return slowly. Repeat, then switch sides.

Exercise: Static bird dog with triceps extension
Variations: Single arm dumbbell triceps kickback on bench
Regression: Single arm dumbbell triceps kickback on bench
Exercise Description:
1. Begin on all fours in a tabletop position with your wrists under your shoulders and knees under your hips. Hold a light dumbbell in your right hand.
2. Extend your left leg straight back until it is parallel to the floor, keeping your core engaged and back flat.
3. Bend your right elbow to bring the dumbbell close to your torso, upper arm parallel to the floor.
4. Keeping your upper arm still, extend your elbow to press the dumbbell straight back until your arm is fully extended.
5. Slowly return the dumbbell to the starting position, maintaining balance throughout. Complete reps on one side, then switch arms and legs.
Audio Script: Start on all fours holding a dumbbell in one hand. Extend the opposite leg straight back. With your elbow up, extend your arm straight back into a triceps kickback. Return slowly, keep balance, and repeat. Switch sides.

Exercise Description:
1. Sit on the triceps extension machine with your back against the pad and feet flat on the floor. Adjust the seat height so your elbows align with the machine’s pivot point.
2. Grip the handles with your palms facing downward or inward, depending on the machine design.
3. Keep your upper arms close to your head or supported against the pad, elbows bent to start.
4. Press the handles downward by extending your elbows until your arms are fully straight.
5. Slowly allow the handles to return to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Sit on the machine with elbows aligned to the pivot. Grip the handles and press them down by extending your elbows, then return slowly. Repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Sit on the machine with your back firmly against the pad and feet flat on the floor. Adjust the seat height so your elbows line up with the machine’s pivot point.
2. Grasp the handles positioned overhead with your palms facing inward.
3. Keep your upper arms close to your head and elbows bent to start, bracing your core.
4. Extend your elbows to press the handles upward in a smooth motion until your arms are fully straight.
5. Slowly return the handles to the starting position behind your head under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Sit on the machine with handles overhead. Keep your elbows close and extend your arms to press the handles up, then return slowly. Repeat.

Animation name: Triceps/cable triceps push down v bar
Exercise Description:
1. Set a cable pulley to the highest setting and attach a V-bar handle. Stand facing the machine with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Grip the V-bar with both hands using a neutral grip (palms facing inward) and bring your elbows close to your torso.
3. Start with your elbows bent at about 90 degrees, forearms pointing forward and down.
4. Press the V-bar down by extending your elbows until your arms are fully straight, keeping elbows tucked in.
5. Slowly return the bar to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Stand facing a high pulley with a V-bar. Keep your elbows close and press the bar down until your arms are straight, then return slowly. Repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Set a cable pulley to the lowest setting and attach a V-bar handle. Stand facing away from the machine and grasp the V-bar with both hands using a neutral grip (palms facing inward). Step forward so the cable runs behind your head and press the bar overhead until your arms are extended.
2. Keep your upper arms close to your head, elbows pointing forward, and brace your core.
3. Bend your elbows to slowly lower the V-bar behind your head in a controlled arc.
4. Stop when you feel a stretch in your triceps, then extend your elbows to press the bar back overhead.
5. Fully extend your arms without forceful lockout, then repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Stand facing away from a low cable with a V-bar. Hold it overhead with elbows close to your head. Lower it behind your head by bending your elbows, then press back up until your arms are extended. Repeat.

3. Start with your elbows bent at about 90 degrees, forearms pointing forward and down.

5. Slowly return the bar to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Stand facing a high pulley with an EZ-curl bar. Keep your elbows close and press the bar down until your arms are straight, then return slowly. Repeat.

Exercise Description:

4. Press the rope down by extending your elbows until your arms are fully straight, separating the rope ends at the bottom.
