Exercise: Horizontal triceps extension with loop band

Overhand triceps pushdown with loop band

Exercise Description:
1. Attach a single-grip handle to each end of a loop band and anchor the middle at about chest height. Stand facing away from the anchor with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Hold a handle in each hand with palms facing away from your body (pronated grip), elbows bent at 90 degrees, and upper arms parallel to the floor. Bring the handles next to your ears.
3. Keep your elbows tucked in and stationary, maintaining the 90-degree angle between your upper arms and torso.
4. Extend your arms fully in front of you until straight, keeping control and tension in the triceps.
5. Slowly return the handles to the starting position next to your ears, then repeat for the desired reps.

Exercise Description:
1. Start in a standard push-up position with your hands together under your chest, forming a diamond shape by touching your thumbs and index fingers.
2. Position your feet hip-width apart and keep your body in a straight line from head to heels.
3. Engage your core and glutes to maintain alignment throughout the movement.
4. Lower your chest toward your hands by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your torso.
5. Push back up to the starting position by straightening your arms, then repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Start in a push-up position with your hands forming a diamond under your chest. Keep your body straight, elbows close, and lower your chest toward your hands. Push back up slowly and repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Adjust the assisted pull-up machine to the desired assistance level. Selecting a heavier weight from the stack increases assistance, making the exercise easier. Kneel or stand on the foot platform as instructed.
2. Grip the pull-up bar with hands wider than shoulder-width apart, palms facing away from you (pronated grip).
3. Hang fully extended with shoulders engaged, chest up, and core tight.
4. Pull your chest up toward the bar by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together.
5. Slowly lower yourself back to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Set the assisted pull-up machine to your level — heavier stack weight gives more assistance and makes it easier. Grip the bar wider than shoulders, palms away. Pull your chest up, squeeze shoulder blades, then lower slowly. Repeat.

Exercise Description:

2. Grip the bar with hands wider than shoulder-width apart, palms facing away (pronated grip).
3. Hang fully extended with shoulders engaged, chest up, and core tight.
4. Pull your chest up toward the bar by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together, using the band for assistance.
5. Slowly lower yourself back to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.

Exercise: Half-kneeling overhand banded bar lat pulldown

Exercise Description:
1. Anchor a loop band to a sturdy overhead point. Attach each end of the loop band to the carabiners at each end of the resistance band bar.
2. Kneel on one knee (half-kneeling) with the other foot in front for balance, facing the anchor.
3. Grip the bar with an overhand (palms down) grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
4. Pull the bar down toward your upper chest by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together, keeping elbows pointed down and back, while maintaining a stable core and upright torso.

Exercise: Cross body banded lat pull around
Variations: Half kneeling single arm banded lat pull down
Regression: Half kneeling single arm banded lat pull down

Variations: Single arm dumbbell row on bench
Regression: Single arm dumbbell row on bench
Exercise Description:
1. Start in a high plank position with a dumbbell in each hand, wrists under shoulders, and feet slightly wider than hip-width for balance.
2. Keep your core tight, back flat, and hips squared to the floor.
3. Row one dumbbell by pulling your elbow toward the ceiling, keeping it close to your body, while stabilizing with the opposite arm.
4. Lower the dumbbell under control back to the floor, then repeat the row on the other side.
5. Alternate sides for the desired number of reps, maintaining a stable torso and neutral spine throughout.
Audio Script: Get into a high plank with a dumbbell in each hand, feet wide for balance. Row one dumbbell toward the ceiling, elbow close to your body, then lower it slowly. Alternate sides, keeping your core tight and hips squared.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart and a barbell in front of you on the floor. Hinge at your hips and bend your knees slightly to grab the bar with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.
2. Keep your back flat, chest forward, and core tight, with your torso roughly parallel to the floor.
3. Row the barbell by pulling it explosively toward your lower chest/upper abdomen, driving with your elbows and keeping them close to your body.
4. Lower the barbell under control to the floor, allowing it to rest completely before the next rep — this distinguishes it from a regular bent-over row.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, keeping your torso parallel to the floor and avoiding any torso swing.
Audio Script: Stand hip-width with a barbell on the floor. Hinge at your hips, grab it overhand, and keep your back flat. Pull the bar explosively to your lower chest, then lower it fully to the floor. Reset each rep, keeping your torso parallel and core tight.

Exercise Description:
1. Set the bar of a Smith machine at roughly waist height. Lie underneath it and grab the bar with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.
2. Position your body straight from head to heels, engaging your core and glutes. Keep your heels on the floor and arms fully extended.
3. Pull your chest toward the bar by driving your elbows back and keeping them close to your body.
4. Pause briefly at the top, squeezing your shoulder blades together, then slowly lower yourself back to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired reps, maintaining a straight body line and controlled movement throughout.
Audio Script: Set a Smith machine bar at waist height. Lie underneath and grab it overhand. Keep your body straight, pull your chest to the bar, squeeze your shoulder blades, then lower slowly. Maintain a tight core and straight line from head to heels.

Exercise Description:
1. Place one end of a barbell into a landmine base. Load the opposite end with the desired weight plates. Stand perpendicular to the bar with your feet hip-width apart, barbell on your side.
2. Hinge at your hips and bend your knees slightly, keeping your back flat and chest up, and grab the loaded end with your inside hand (hand closest to the bar).
3. Row the barbell by pulling your elbow back and up toward your torso, focusing on squeezing your lats and keeping your shoulder blade engaged.
4. Lower the barbell under control back to the starting position, fully extending your arm.
5. Repeat for the desired reps, then switch sides. Keep your torso stable and avoid twisting your spine during the movement.
Audio Script: Place one end of a barbell into a landmine base and load the other end with weight. Stand perpendicular, hinge at your hips, grab the loaded end with the inside hand. Pull your elbow back and up, squeeze your lat, then lower slowly. Keep your torso stable. Repeat, then switch sides.

Exercise Description:
1. Place one end of a barbell into a landmine base and load the opposite end with the desired weight plates. Stand straddling the bar, feet shoulder-width apart, so the bar passes under your legs.
2. Hinge at your hips and bend your knees slightly, keeping your back flat, chest up, and core engaged. Grab the loaded end with both hands using a neutral grip (palms facing each other), keeping arms fully extended.
3. Row the barbell by pulling it toward your lower chest or upper abdomen, driving elbows back and squeezing your shoulder blades.
4. Lower the barbell under control back to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
5. Repeat for the desired reps, maintaining a flat back, tight core, and stable torso, avoiding any twisting or jerking motions.
Audio Script: Place one end of a barbell in a landmine base and load the other end. Stand over the bar so it passes under your legs. Hinge at your hips, grab the bar with both hands, and row it to your lower chest or upper abdomen. Squeeze your shoulder blades, then lower slowly. Keep your back flat and torso stable throughout.

Exercise Description:
1. Place one end of a barbell into a landmine base and load the opposite end with the desired weight plates. Stand perpendicular to the bar with your feet hip-width apart, barbell on your side.
2. Hinge at your hips and bend your knees slightly, keeping your back flat, chest up, and core engaged. Grab the loaded end with your inside hand (hand closest to the bar) using a neutral grip (palm facing in).
3. Row the barbell by pulling your elbow back and slightly up toward your torso, focusing on squeezing your lats and keeping your shoulder blade engaged.
4. Lower the barbell under control back to the starting position, fully extending your arm.
5. Repeat for the desired reps, then switch arms. Maintain torso stability and avoid twisting your spine during the movement.
Audio Script: Place one end of a barbell in a landmine base and load the other end. Stand perpendicular, hinge at your hips, grab the loaded end with your inside hand. Pull your elbow back and slightly up, squeeze your lat, then lower slowly. Keep your torso stable. Repeat, then switch arms.

Exercise Description:
1. Sit on the pullover machine and rest your upper arms against the vertical pads, keeping your elbows aligned with the pads. Your chest should remain upright and close to the backrest if present.
2. Grasp the bar above your head with an overhand grip (palms facing away from you), ensuring your hands are shoulder-width apart.
3. Start with your elbows bent and the bar positioned above your head, maintaining contact with the pads.
4. Press the bar down and forward in a controlled motion by extending your elbows and driving through the pads, until your arms are almost straight or in line with your torso. Focus on engaging your lats.
5. Slowly return to the starting position under control, keeping your elbows on the pads, then repeat for the desired reps. Maintain a stable torso and tight core throughout.
Audio Script: Sit and rest your upper arms on the vertical pads. Grab the bar above your head with an overhand grip. Press down and forward through the pads, squeezing your lats, then slowly return. Keep your torso stable and repeat.

Exercise: Plate loaded lat pull down machine
Animation name: Back/Hammer Strength Plate Loaded High Row Both Arms
Equipment: Plate loaded lat pull down machine
Exercise Description:
1. Sit on the machine and adjust the thigh pad so it rests snugly against your thighs to prevent your body from lifting during the exercise.
2. Grasp the lat pulldown bar with the desired grip: wide overhand grip (palms away) or neutral grip (palms facing each other).
3. Start with your arms fully extended overhead and your torso upright, slightly leaning back if necessary for comfort.
4. Pull the bar down toward your upper chest or collarbone, leading with your elbows and focusing on engaging your lats. Avoid using momentum; keep your torso stable.
5. Slowly return the bar to the starting position under control, fully extending your arms, then repeat for the desired reps. Maintain a tight core and neutral spine throughout.
Audio Script: Sit and secure your thighs under the pad. Grab the bar with the desired grip. Pull it down to your upper chest, squeezing your lats, then return slowly. Keep your torso stable and repeat.

Animation name: Back/prone bench row barbell pronate grip
Exercise Description:

2. Grab the handles with a neutral grip (palms facing each other) or overhand grip depending on your setup.
3. Start with your arms fully extended and shoulders relaxed.
4. Row the handles toward your lower chest or upper abdomen, driving your elbows back and squeezing your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement.
5. Slowly lower the handles under control back to the starting position, fully extending your arms, then repeat for the desired reps. Keep your torso pressed against the pad and avoid using momentum.
Audio Script: Lie chest-down on the pad, feet on the floor. Grab the handles with a neutral or overhand grip. Row the handles to your lower chest, squeeze your shoulder blades, then lower slowly. Keep your torso pressed against the pad and repeat.

Variations: Seated single arm row with rope

Exercise Description:

Exercise: Straight arm lat pull down with bar
Variations: Bent-over Straight arm lat pull down with bar
Straight arm lat pull down with rope
Bent-over straight arm lat pull down with rope
Progression: Bent-over Straight arm lat pull down with bar
Exercise Description:
1. Stand facing a high pulley with a curl bar attached to the cable, feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent.
2. Grab the bar with an overhand (pronated) grip, hands about shoulder-width apart.
3. Keep your arms fully extended in front of you and maintain a slight bend in the knees, chest up, and core engaged.
4. Pull the bar down toward your thighs in a controlled motion, keeping arms straight throughout the movement, focusing on contracting your lats.
5. Slowly return the bar to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Stand facing a high pulley with a curl bar. Grab it overhand, arms straight. Pull the bar down toward your thighs, keeping arms straight and lats engaged, then slowly return. Repeat.

Exercise: Bent-over Straight arm lat pull down with bar
Variations: Straight arm lat pull down with bar
Straight arm lat pull down with rope
Bent-over straight arm lat pull down with rope
Regression: Straight arm lat pull down with bar
Exercise Description:
1. Attach a bar (e.g., curl bar or straight bar) to a high pulley. Stand facing the pulley with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Hinge at the hips until your torso is roughly parallel to the floor, knees slightly bent, and core engaged. Your arms should start overhead, holding the bar with an overhand (pronated) grip.
3. Keep your arms fully extended, shoulders down, and chest slightly lifted.
4. Pull the bar down in a controlled arc toward your thighs, keeping your arms straight and focusing on contracting your lats.
5. Slowly return the bar to the starting overhead position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Stand facing a high pulley, hinge at your hips so your torso is parallel to the floor, arms overhead holding the bar. Pull the bar down in an arc toward your thighs, keeping arms straight and lats engaged. Slowly return and repeat.

Exercise: Straight arm lat pull down with rope
Variations: Straight arm lat pull down with bar
Bent-over Straight arm lat pull down with bar
Bent-over straight arm lat pull down with rope
Progression: Bent-over straight arm lat pull down with rope
Exercise Description:
1. Attach a rope to a high pulley. Stand facing the pulley with feet shoulder-width apart, torso upright, and knees slightly bent.
2. Hold the rope ends with an overhand (pronated) grip, arms fully extended overhead.
3. Keep your arms straight, shoulders down, chest lifted, and core engaged.
4. Pull the rope down in an arc toward your thighs, letting the ends separate naturally as you reach the bottom. Focus on contracting your lats without leaning or swinging your torso.
5. Slowly return the rope to the starting overhead position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.

Variations: Straight arm lat pull down with bar

Variations: Single arm dumbbell row on bench
Regression: Single arm dumbbell row on bench
Exercise Description:
1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with a neutral grip (palms facing each other) and stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Hinge at the hips until your torso is roughly parallel to the floor (slight bend in the knees), keeping your core tight and back flat. Let the dumbbells hang straight down from your shoulders.
3. Keep your arms fully extended, shoulders down, and chest slightly lifted.
4. Pull the dumbbells simultaneously toward your torso by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together. Keep elbows tucked close to your body and torso stationary.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbells to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Hold a dumbbell in each hand, hinge at your hips until torso is parallel to the floor, arms straight. Pull the dumbbells toward your torso, squeezing your shoulder blades. Lower slowly and repeat.

Variations: Single arm dumbbell row on bench
Regression: Single arm dumbbell row on bench
Exercise Description:
1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with an underhand (supinated) grip — palms facing forward — and stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Hinge at the hips until your torso is roughly parallel to the floor (slight bend in the knees), keeping your core tight and back flat. Let the dumbbells hang straight down from your shoulders.
3. Keep your arms fully extended, shoulders down, and chest slightly lifted.
4. Pull the dumbbells simultaneously toward your torso by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together, keeping elbows close to your body and torso stationary.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbells to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Hold a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing forward, hinge at your hips until torso is parallel to the floor. Pull the dumbbells toward your torso, squeezing your shoulder blades. Lower slowly and repeat.

Exercise: Single arm dumbbell row on bench
Exercise Description:
1. Place your left knee and left hand on a flat bench for support, keeping your back flat and core engaged. Hold a dumbbell in your right hand with a neutral grip (palm facing your torso).
2. Position your right foot on the floor for stability and let your right arm hang straight down from your shoulder, dumbbell in hand.
3. Keep your shoulder down and chest slightly lifted.
4. Pull the dumbbell toward your torso by bending your elbow and squeezing your shoulder blade toward your spine, keeping your torso stationary.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbell to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps before switching sides.
Audio Script: Place your left knee and hand on a bench, hold a dumbbell in your right hand. Pull the dumbbell toward your torso, squeezing your shoulder blade. Lower slowly and repeat. Switch sides.

Animation name: Back/Dumbbell Hammer Grip Incline Bench Two Arm Row
Variations: Single arm dumbbell row on bench
Exercise Description:
1. Set an incline bench at about 30–45 degrees. Lie face down on the bench with your chest supported and feet firmly on the ground or bench supports. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with a neutral grip (palms facing each other), letting the arms hang straight down.
2. Keep your shoulders down, chest pressed lightly against the bench, and core engaged.
3. Pull the dumbbells toward your torso by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together, keeping elbows close to your body.
4. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, focusing on contracting the lats and upper back.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbells to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.

Exercise Description:
1. Grip a barbell with an underhand (supinated) grip — palms facing forward — at about shoulder width. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Hinge at the hips until your torso is roughly parallel to the floor (slight bend in the knees), keeping your back flat and core tight. Let the barbell hang straight down from your shoulders.
3. Keep your arms fully extended, shoulders down, and chest slightly lifted.
4. Pull the barbell toward your torso by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together, keeping elbows close to your body and torso stationary.
5. Slowly lower the barbell to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Grip a barbell with palms facing forward, hinge at your hips until torso is parallel to the floor. Pull the barbell toward your torso, squeezing your shoulder blades. Lower slowly and repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Grip a barbell with an overhand (pronated) grip — palms facing toward you — at about shoulder width. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Hinge at the hips until your torso is roughly parallel to the floor (slight bend in the knees), keeping your back flat and core engaged. Let the barbell hang straight down from your shoulders.
3. Keep your arms fully extended, shoulders down, and chest slightly lifted.
4. Pull the barbell toward your torso by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together, keeping elbows close to your body and torso stationary.
5. Slowly lower the barbell to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Grip a barbell with palms facing you, hinge at your hips until torso is parallel to the floor. Pull the barbell toward your torso, squeezing your shoulder blades. Lower slowly and repeat.

Exercise: Half kneeling underhand row with loop band
Variations: Half kneeling Overhand row with loop band
Half kneeling neutral grip row with loop band
Exercise Description:
1. Anchor the middle of the loop band to a sturdy point so that when you kneel, the band is roughly at chest height.
2. Step into a half-kneeling position, right knee down and left foot forward (or opposite, depending on stability).
3. Grab one handle in each hand with an underhand grip (palms facing up), ensuring both sides of the band are equal.
4. Pull the handles toward your torso by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades, keeping your torso upright and core engaged.
5. Slowly return to the starting position under control and repeat for desired reps, switching legs if needed.
Audio Script: Anchor the middle of the band so that when you kneel, it is roughly at chest height. Step into a half-kneeling position, hold the handles with palms up. Pull toward your torso, squeezing your shoulder blades. Lower slowly and repeat. Switch sides.

Exercise Description:
1. Attach a single-grip handle to each end of the loop band, then anchor the middle of the band to a sturdy point at about waist to chest height.

3. Grab one handle in each hand with an underhand grip (palms facing up), making sure both sides of the band are equal in length.
4. Pull the handles toward your torso by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together, keeping your torso upright.
5. Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position under control, maintaining tension in the band, then repeat for the desired reps.

Exercise Description:
1. Attach a rope handle to a cable machine pulley set at torso height (relative to your kneeling position).
2. Kneel on one knee and place the opposite foot forward on the floor to create a stable staggered stance.
3. Grab the rope with both hands, palms facing each other, arms fully extended, torso upright, and core engaged.
4. Pull the rope toward your torso by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together, keeping your torso stable.
5. Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.

Exercise Description:
1. Anchor the middle of a loop band to a sturdy point at approximately torso height (relative to your kneeling position).
2. Attach a rope attachment to the anchored band.
3. Kneel on one knee with the opposite foot forward for stability.
4. Grab the rope with both hands, arms fully extended, torso upright, and core engaged.
5. Pull the rope toward your torso by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades, keeping your torso stable. Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position, then repeat for the desired reps.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with arms fully extended at your sides, palms facing your torso.
2. Keep your back straight, chest up, and core engaged.
3. Shrug your shoulders upward as high as possible toward your ears, avoiding bending your elbows.
4. Hold the contraction at the top for 1–2 seconds, focusing on squeezing the traps.
5. Slowly lower your shoulders back to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Stand with dumbbells at your sides. Keep your back straight and shrug your shoulders up toward your ears. Hold briefly, then lower slowly. Repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell in front of your thighs with a pronated grip (palms facing your body).
2. Keep your back straight, chest up, and core engaged.
3. Shrug your shoulders upward as high as possible toward your ears, avoiding bending your elbows.
4. Hold the contraction at the top for 1–2 seconds, focusing on squeezing the traps.
5. Slowly lower your shoulders back to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Stand with a barbell in front of your thighs. Keep your back straight and shrug your shoulders up toward your ears. Hold briefly, then lower slowly. Repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell with an underhand (supinated) grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.
2. Keep your elbows close to your torso, back straight, and core engaged.
3. Curl the barbell upward toward your chest by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms stationary.
4. Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position under control.
5. Repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Stand with a barbell in an underhand grip. Keep elbows close to your torso and curl the barbell up toward your chest. Lower slowly and repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell with an overhand (pronated) grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.
2. Keep your elbows close to your torso, back straight, and core engaged.
3. Curl the barbell upward toward your chest by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms stationary.
4. Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position under control.
5. Repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Stand with a barbell in an overhand grip. Keep elbows close to your torso and curl the barbell up toward your chest. Lower slowly and repeat.

Animation name: Biceps/preacher curl ez bar close grip
Exercise Description:
1. Sit on a preacher bench and place your upper arms flat against the pad. Hold a barbell with an underhand (supinated) grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Keep your chest against the bench and your back straight.
3. Curl the barbell upward by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms pressed to the pad.
4. Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position without fully locking your elbows.
5. Repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Sit on a preacher bench with your upper arms on the pad. Hold a barbell underhand, curl it up, then lower slowly without locking your elbows. Repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Set up an incline bench at about 45 degrees and lie chest-down, letting your arms hang straight down toward the floor. Hold a barbell with an underhand (supinated) grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Keep your chest pressed against the bench and your back straight.
3. Curl the barbell upward by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms fixed and perpendicular to the floor.
4. Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
5. Repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Lie chest-down on an incline bench with arms hanging. Hold a barbell underhand, curl it up, then lower slowly, fully extending your arms. Repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand upright with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with an underhand (supinated) grip.
2. Keep your elbows close to your torso and your back straight.
3. Curl the dumbbells upward by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms stationary.
4. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
5. Repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Stand with dumbbells at your sides, palms facing forward. Curl them up without moving your upper arms, then lower slowly, fully extending your arms. Repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Sit on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand with an underhand (supinated) grip.
2. Keep your back straight, chest up, and elbows close to your torso.
3. Curl the dumbbells upward by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms stationary.
4. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
5. Repeat for the desired reps.
Audio Script: Sit on a bench with feet flat, dumbbells at your sides, palms forward. Curl them up without moving your upper arms, then lower slowly, fully extending your arms. Repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with your arms fully extended by your sides and palms facing forward.
2. Keep your back straight, chest up, and core engaged.
3. Curl one dumbbell upward toward your shoulder, fully contracting the bicep.
4. Lower the dumbbell back to the starting position under control.
5. Repeat the movement with the opposite arm, alternating for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Stand tall with a dumbbell in each hand, palms forward. Curl one dumbbell fully to your shoulder, lower slowly, then curl the other. Keep alternating.

Exercise Description:
1. Sit on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand with an underhand (supinated) grip, palms facing forward.
2. Keep your elbows close to your torso and your back straight; avoid leaning back.
3. Curl one dumbbell fully toward your shoulder by bending the elbow, keeping your upper arm stationary.
4. Slowly lower that dumbbell back to the starting position under control.
5. Repeat with the other arm, alternating for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Sit tall on a flat bench, feet flat. Hold dumbbells palms forward. Curl one dumbbell fully to your shoulder, lower it, then curl the other. Alternate arms for each rep, keeping your back straight.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended at your sides.
2. Hold the dumbbells with a neutral grip — palms facing each other.
3. Keeping your upper arms stationary, curl the dumbbells upward by bending your elbows, maintaining the neutral grip.
4. Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, either simultaneously or alternating arms.
Audio Script: Stand tall with a dumbbell in each hand at your sides, palms facing each other. Curl the dumbbells up while keeping palms facing each other, then lower them slowly. Repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Sit on a flat bench with feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Hold the dumbbells with a neutral grip — palms facing each other.
3. Keep your upper arms stationary and curl the dumbbells upward by bending your elbows, maintaining the neutral grip.
4. Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position under control, without swinging.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended at your sides.
2. Keep a neutral grip — palms facing each other throughout the movement.
3. Curl one dumbbell upward by bending the elbow while keeping the other arm stationary.
4. Lower the dumbbell back to the starting position under control, then curl the other dumbbell.
5. Continue alternating for the desired number of reps, completing one full rep with each arm before switching.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with a neutral grip (palms facing each other).
2. Keep your arms fully extended at your sides.
3. Curl the dumbbell across your body toward the opposite shoulder, keeping the other arm stationary.
4. Lower the dumbbell slowly back to the starting position under control.
5. Alternate arms for the desired number of reps, completing one full rep with each arm before switching.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with a supinated grip (palms facing forward).
2. Keep your elbows close to your torso, and curl the dumbbells up toward your shoulders.
3. At the top, rotate your wrists so your palms face downward (pronated grip).
4. Slowly lower the dumbbells to the starting position, rotating your wrists back to supinated grip as you reach the bottom.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Exercise Description:
1. Sit on an incline bench (45–60°) holding a dumbbell in each hand with a supinated grip (palms facing forward).
2. Let your arms hang fully extended at your sides, elbows close to your torso, back resting against the bench.
3. Curl the dumbbells upward toward your shoulders in a controlled manner.
4. Lower the dumbbells slowly back to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Exercise Description:
1. Sit on a preacher bench with a dumbbell in each hand, arms resting on the angled pad.
2. Hold the dumbbells with a supinated grip (palms facing up).
3. Curl the dumbbells toward your shoulders while keeping your upper arms against the pad.
4. Slowly lower the dumbbells back toward the starting position, avoiding locking your elbows.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Exercise Description:
1. Lie face down on an incline bench, chest supported, with a dumbbell in each hand.
2. Let your arms hang straight down, holding the dumbbells with a supinated grip (palms facing up).
3. Curl the dumbbells toward your shoulders.
4. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Exercise Description:

2. Let your arms hang straight down, holding the dumbbells with a supinated grip (palms facing up).
3. Curl one dumbbell toward your shoulder while the other arm remains extended.
4. Slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position, fully extending your arm, then repeat with the other arm.
5. Continue alternating for the desired number of reps.

Exercise Description:

2. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding the rope with a neutral grip (palms facing each other).
3. Keep elbows close to your torso.
4. Curl the rope upward toward your shoulders.
5. Slowly lower the rope back to the starting position. Repeat for the desired reps.

3. Keep elbows close to your torso.
4. Curl the bar upward toward your shoulders.
5. Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position. Repeat for the desired reps.

5. Slowly lower the handle back to the starting position. Repeat for the desired reps.

Exercise Description:

2. Stand facing away from the machine with feet shoulder-width apart, holding the handle with a supinated grip (palm facing up).
3. Keep your elbow close to your torso.
4. Curl the handle toward your shoulder in a controlled motion.
5. Slowly lower the handle back to the starting position, fully extending your elbow.

Exercise Description:
1. Attach a single grip handle to a high pulley on a cable machine.
2. Stand to the side of the pulley, feet shoulder-width apart, holding the handle with a supinated grip (palm facing up).
3. Extend your working arm out to the side at shoulder height.
4. Curl the handle toward your shoulder in a controlled motion, keeping your upper arm roughly parallel to the floor.
5. Slowly lower the handle back to the starting position, fully extending your arm. Repeat for desired reps.

Regression: Alternating bicep curls with loop band

2. Grab the handles with a supinated grip (palms facing forward).
3. Step on the middle of the band with one foot, standing with feet staggered for stability.
4. Curl the handles up toward your shoulders, keeping elbows soft and controlled.
5. Slowly lower back to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Exercise: Alternating bicep curls with loop band
Exercise Description:

2. Grab the handles with a supinated grip (palms facing forward).
3. Step on the middle of the band with one foot, using a staggered stance for stability.
4. Curl one handle toward your shoulder while keeping the other arm extended.
5. Slowly lower the handle back to the starting position. Alternate arms for the desired number of reps.

Regression: Alternating bicep curls with Handle band

2. Grab the handles with a supinated grip (palms facing forward).
3. Keep your elbows close to your torso.
4. Curl the handles toward your shoulders.
5. Slowly lower the handles back to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Stand on the middle of the handle band, grab handles palms forward. Curl toward shoulders, then slowly lower back down. Repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand with one foot on the middle of the handle band and the other slightly behind for stability.
2. Grab the handles with a supinated grip (palms facing forward).
3. Keep your elbows close to your torso.
4. Curl one handle toward your shoulder while keeping the other arm extended.

Variations: Banded Squat to Lateral Leg Lifts
Exercise Description:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Keep your chest upright, shoulders back, and core engaged.
3. Begin the movement by pushing your hips back and bending your knees, lowering down as if sitting in a chair.
4. Go down until your thighs are at least parallel to the floor, keeping your weight evenly distributed across your feet.
5. Stand back up to the starting position by extending your hips and knees. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, chest up and core tight. Push your hips back and bend your knees, lowering down as if sitting in a chair. Go until your thighs are parallel to the floor, keeping weight evenly on your feet. Stand back up by extending your hips and knees. Repeat.

Exercise: Bodyweight squats with lateral leg lifts
Variations: Banded Squat to Lateral Leg Lifts
Progression: Banded squat to lateral leg lifts
Exercise Description:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, chest upright, core engaged.
2. Perform a standard bodyweight squat by pushing your hips back and bending your knees.
3. As you stand up, lift your right leg out to the side, keeping it straight.
4. Lower your leg back down as you go into the next squat.
5. Alternate legs with each squat and repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Stand tall, chest up, core tight. Squat down by pushing your hips back and bending your knees. As you stand up, lift one leg out to the side, then lower it as you go into the next squat. Alternate legs with each rep.

Variations: Banded Squat to Lateral Leg Lifts
Progression: Banded squat to lateral leg lifts
Exercise Description:
1. Place a mini loop band just above your knees and stand with feet shoulder-width apart, chest upright, core engaged.
2. Perform a standard squat by bending your knees and pushing your hips back.
3. Keep tension on the band throughout the movement, preventing your knees from caving inward.
4. Stand back up by straightening your legs, maintaining the band’s tension.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Place a mini loop band above your knees. Stand tall, chest up, core tight. Squat down by bending your knees and pushing your hips back, keeping tension on the band. Stand up while maintaining the band’s resistance. Repeat.

Exercise: Banded squat to lateral leg lifts
Exercise Description:
1. Place a mini loop band just above your knees and stand with feet shoulder-width apart, chest upright, core engaged.
2. Perform a standard squat by bending your knees and pushing your hips back.
3. Stand up from the squat and lift one leg out to the side, keeping the band under tension and core engaged.
4. Lower the leg back down and repeat the movement with the other leg.
5. Continue alternating leg lifts for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Place a mini loop band above your knees. Squat down by bending your knees and pushing hips back. Stand up and lift one leg to the side, keeping the band tight. Lower it and repeat with the other leg. Alternate for all reps.

Variations: Banded Squat to Lateral Leg Lifts
Exercise Description:
1. Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes pointing slightly outward, chest upright, core engaged.
2. Bend your knees and push your hips back, lowering your body toward the floor.
3. Keep your weight evenly distributed across your feet.
4. Push through your feet to return to standing.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Stand with feet wider than shoulders, toes pointing out. Lower your hips by bending your knees, keeping your chest up and weight evenly on your feet. Push back up to standing. Repeat.

Variations: Banded Squat to Lateral Leg Lifts
Exercise Description:
1. Stand with feet about shoulder-width apart, chest upright, core engaged.
2. Lower down into a full squat.
3. Rise halfway up from the squat.
4. Lower back down to the full squat, then rise all the way to standing.
5. That full sequence counts as one rep; repeat for desired reps.
Audio Script: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart. Lower into a full squat, rise halfway up, then lower back down and press all the way up to standing. That counts as one rep; repeat for desired reps.

Variations: Banded Squat to Lateral Leg Lifts
Exercise Description:
1. Stand with feet about shoulder-width apart, chest upright, core engaged.
2. Lower into a squat, keeping weight evenly distributed across your feet.
3. Explosively jump upward as you rise from the squat.
4. Land softly back into a squat position, absorbing impact with your legs.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart. Lower into a squat, then jump up explosively. Land softly back into the squat and repeat for desired reps.

Variations: Banded Squat to Lateral Leg Lifts
Exercise Description:
1. Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes pointing forward or slightly outward.
2. Shift your weight onto one leg and bend that knee, keeping the other leg straight, heel grounded, and toes slightly lifted if needed.
3. Lower your hips toward the bent knee, keeping your chest upright and core engaged.
4. Push through the bent leg to return to the starting wide stance.
5. Complete all reps on one leg before switching to the other leg.
Audio Script: Stand with feet wide. Shift weight to one leg and lower hips, keeping the other leg straight, heel on the ground, toes lifted if needed. Return to wide stance. Complete all reps on that leg, then switch to the other leg.

Variations: Banded Squat to Lateral Leg Lifts
Exercise Description:
1. Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes pointing forward or slightly outward.
2. Shift your weight onto one leg and bend that knee, keeping the other leg straight, heel grounded, and toes slightly lifted if needed for balance.
3. Lower your hips toward the bent knee, keeping your chest upright and core engaged.
4. Push through the bent leg to return to the starting wide stance, then immediately shift to the opposite leg.
5. Continue alternating legs for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Stand with feet wide. Shift weight to one leg, lower hips, keeping the other leg straight, heel on the ground, toes lifted if needed. Return to wide stance, then shift to the other leg. Alternate legs for each rep.

Variations: Banded Squat to Lateral Leg Lifts
Exercise Description:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, toes pointing forward or slightly outward.
2. Place a sturdy box or bench behind you at a height where your thighs will be roughly parallel to the ground when seated.
3. Lower your hips back and down in a controlled motion until your glutes lightly touch the box, keeping your chest upright and core engaged.
4. Pause briefly on the box.
5. Push through your feet to return to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, box behind you. Lower hips back to lightly touch the box, keeping chest up and core tight. Pause, then push through your feet to stand back up.

Variations: Banded Squat to Lateral Leg Lifts
Exercise Description:
1. Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes pointing slightly outward.
2. Place a sturdy box or bench behind you at a height where your thighs will be roughly parallel to the ground when seated.
3. Lower your hips back and down in a controlled motion until your glutes lightly touch the box, keeping your chest upright and core engaged.
4. Pause briefly on the box.
5. Press through your feet to return to standing. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Stand with feet wide and toes slightly outward, box behind you. Lower hips back to lightly touch the box, keeping chest up and core tight. Pause, then press through your feet to stand back up.

Variations: Banded Squat to Lateral Leg Lifts
Exercise Description:
1. Stand on one leg in front of a sturdy box or bench, the other leg slightly lifted in front of you for balance.
2. Lower your hips back and down in a controlled motion, bending the standing leg, until your glutes lightly touch the box. Keep your chest upright and core engaged.
3. Pause briefly on the box, maintaining tension in your leg muscles.
4. Press through your heel to rise back to standing.
5. Repeat for the desired reps, then switch legs.
Audio Script: Stand on one leg in front of a box, other leg slightly raised. Lower your hips to lightly touch the box, keeping chest up and core tight. Pause, then press through your heel to stand. Switch legs after desired reps.

Variations: Banded Squat to Lateral Leg Lifts
Exercise Description:
1. Stand on one leg with the other leg extended straight in front of you, arms extended forward for balance if needed.
2. Lower your hips down and back in a controlled motion, keeping the extended leg off the ground. Maintain an upright torso and tight core.
3. Descend as far as your mobility allows, ideally until your thigh is parallel to the floor or lower.
4. Press through the heel of the standing leg to return to the starting position.
5. Repeat for desired reps, then switch legs.
Audio Script: Stand on one leg with the other extended in front. Lower hips down and back, keeping chest up and core engaged. Go as low as you can, then press through your heel to stand. Switch legs after reps.

Variations: Banded Squat to Lateral Leg Lifts
Exercise Description:
1. Stand on one leg on a raised surface (like a low step or platform), with the other leg extended forward for balance.
2. Lower your hips straight down in a controlled motion, letting the extended leg hover or lightly tap the ground if needed.
3. Descend as far as your mobility allows, ideally until the standing thigh is parallel to the platform or lower.
4. Press through the heel of the standing leg to return to the starting position.
5. Repeat for desired reps, then switch legs.
Audio Script: Stand on one leg on a raised surface with the other leg extended forward. Lower your hips carefully, letting the extended leg hover or lightly tap the ground. Go as low as your mobility allows, then press through your heel to stand. Switch legs after reps.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand with your back against a wall, feet shoulder-width apart and about 1–2 feet away from the wall.
2. Slide your back down the wall until your knees are bent at approximately 90 degrees, thighs parallel to the floor.
3. Ensure your knees stay roughly above your heels and keep your back flat against the wall, engaging your core.
4. Hold this position for the desired duration, maintaining even weight distribution through your feet.
5. Slowly slide back up to standing to finish the set.
Audio Script: Lean against a wall with your feet a bit away. Slide down until your thighs are parallel and knees are roughly above your heels. Keep your back flat and core engaged. Hold, then slide back up to stand.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand with your back against a wall, feet shoulder-width apart and about 1–2 feet away from the wall.
2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, keeping them at your sides or resting on your thighs.
3. Slide your back down the wall until your knees are bent at approximately 90 degrees, thighs parallel to the floor.
4. Ensure your knees stay roughly above your heels, back stays flat, and core is engaged.
5. Hold this position for the desired duration, then slowly slide back up to standing.
Audio Script: Hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides and lean against a wall. Slide down until your thighs are parallel and knees are roughly above your heels. Keep your back flat and core tight. Hold, then slide back up.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand with your back against a wall, feet shoulder-width apart and slightly forward from the wall.
2. Slide your back down the wall into a squat position, thighs roughly parallel to the floor, knees roughly above the heels.
3. Push through your feet to rise back up, keeping your back in contact with the wall.
4. Repeat the lowering and rising motion in a controlled manner for the desired number of reps.
5. Focus on engaging your core and keeping your knees aligned above your feet throughout the movement.
Audio Script: Lean your back against a wall, feet shoulder-width apart and slightly forward. Slide down into a squat, then push back up, keeping knees above your heels and back in contact with the wall. Repeat smoothly for reps.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand with your back against a wall, feet shoulder-width apart and slightly forward.
2. Slide down into a wall sit, thighs roughly parallel to the floor, knees above the heels.
3. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing forward (supinated grip).
4. Perform a bicep curl, bringing the dumbbells toward your shoulders while maintaining the wall sit position.
5. Lower the dumbbells back down in a controlled manner. Repeat for desired reps.
Audio Script: Lean your back against a wall and slide down into a squat. Hold dumbbells with palms forward, curl them up to your shoulders, then lower slowly, keeping the wall sit position. Repeat for reps.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand with feet about shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell close to your chest with both hands (vertical position).
2. Keep your chest upright and shoulders back.
3. Lower into a squat by bending your knees and hips, keeping your weight evenly distributed across your feet.
4. Pause briefly at the bottom of the squat.
5. Push through your feet to return to standing. Repeat for desired reps.
Audio Script: Hold a dumbbell at your chest, stand tall, then lower into a squat. Pause at the bottom, then stand back up. Repeat for reps.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes slightly pointing out, holding a dumbbell vertically close to your chest with both hands.
2. Keep your chest up, back straight, and shoulders relaxed.
3. Squat down by bending your knees and pushing your hips back, keeping your weight evenly distributed on your feet.
4. Push through your feet to rise back up to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Hold a dumbbell close to your chest and stand with feet wide, toes slightly out. Squat down, keeping your chest up and back straight, then rise back up. Repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell vertically close to your chest with both hands.
2. Keep your chest up, back straight, and shoulders relaxed.
3. Sit back onto a box behind you by bending your knees and pushing your hips back, keeping your weight evenly distributed on your feet.
4. Stand back up by pushing through your feet to return to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Hold a dumbbell close to your chest and stand tall. Sit back onto the box, keeping your chest up and back straight, then push through your feet to stand. Repeat smoothly.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand on one leg while holding a dumbbell vertically close to your chest with both hands.
2. Keep your chest up, back straight, and shoulders relaxed.
3. Slowly sit back onto a box behind you, bending only the standing leg and keeping the other leg extended in front.
4. Stand back up through the standing leg to return to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired reps, then switch legs.
Audio Script: Hold a dumbbell close to your chest while standing on one leg. Sit back onto the box, keeping your chest up and back straight, and extend the other leg forward. Push through the standing leg to rise. Repeat for the desired reps, then switch legs.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand on one leg while holding a dumbbell vertically close to your chest with both hands.
2. Keep your chest up, back straight, and shoulders relaxed.
3. Slowly lower into a full single-leg squat, extending the other leg forward in front of you.
4. Press through the standing leg to return to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired reps, then switch legs.
Audio Script: Hold a dumbbell close to your chest while standing on one leg. Lower into a full squat, extending the other leg forward. Push through the standing leg to rise. Repeat for desired reps, then switch legs.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand on a platform or step with one leg, holding a dumbbell close to your chest with both hands.
2. Keep your chest up, back straight, and shoulders relaxed.
3. Slowly lower into a single-leg squat, letting the other leg extend forward (you can lightly tap the ground with the heel if needed).
4. Press through the standing leg to return to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired reps, then switch legs.
Audio Script: Stand on a platform on one leg, holding a dumbbell at your chest. Lower into a single-leg squat, letting the other leg extend forward and lightly tap the ground if needed. Push through the standing leg to rise. Repeat and switch legs.

Variations: Kettlebell goblet single leg box squat
Elevated kettlebell single leg goblet squat
Exercise Description:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell close to your chest with both hands.
2. Keep your chest up, back straight, and shoulders relaxed.
3. Lower into a squat by bending your knees and pushing your hips back, keeping weight evenly distributed through your feet.
4. Push through your feet to rise back to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell at your chest. Squat down, keeping weight evenly through your feet, then push through your feet to rise. Repeat.

Variations: Kettlebell goblet single leg box squat
Elevated kettlebell single leg goblet squat
Exercise Description:
1. Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes pointing out, holding a kettlebell close to your chest with both hands.
2. Keep your chest up, back straight, and shoulders relaxed.
3. Lower into a squat by bending your knees and pushing your hips back, keeping weight evenly distributed through your feet.
4. Push through your feet to rise back to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Stand with feet wide and toes pointing out, holding a kettlebell at your chest. Squat down, keeping weight evenly through your feet, then push through your feet to rise. Repeat.

Variations: Kettlebell goblet single leg box squat
Elevated kettlebell single leg goblet squat
Exercise Description:
1. Stand in front of a sturdy box or bench with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell close to your chest with both hands.
2. Keep your chest up, back straight, and shoulders relaxed.
3. Lower into a squat by bending your knees and pushing your hips back until you lightly touch the box with your glutes.
4. Push through your feet to rise back to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Stand in front of a box, holding a kettlebell at your chest. Squat down until your glutes lightly touch the box, then push through your feet to rise. Repeat.

Exercise: Kettlebell goblet single leg box squat
Variations: Elevated kettlebell single leg goblet squat
Progression: Elevated kettlebell single leg goblet squat
Exercise Description:
1. Stand on one leg in front of a sturdy box or bench, holding a kettlebell close to your chest with both hands.
2. Keep your chest up, back straight, and shoulders relaxed.
3. Slowly lower yourself by bending the standing knee and pushing your hips back until your glutes lightly touch the box.
4. Push through your standing foot to rise back to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired reps and switch sides.
Audio Script: Stand on one leg holding a kettlebell at your chest. Squat down until your glutes lightly touch the box. Push through your foot to rise. Repeat for desired reps and switch sides.

Variations: Kettlebell goblet single leg box squat
Elevated kettlebell single leg goblet squat
Regression: Elevated kettlebell single leg goblet squat
Exercise Description:
1. Stand on one leg, holding a kettlebell close to your chest with both hands.
2. Extend the non-working leg straight in front of you, keeping it off the ground.
3. Slowly lower yourself by bending the standing knee and pushing your hips back, keeping your chest up and back straight.
4. Go as low as your mobility allows while maintaining balance.
5. Push through the standing foot to return to the starting position. Repeat for desired reps and switch sides.
Audio Script: Stand on one leg holding a kettlebell at your chest. Extend your other leg in front of you. Squat down as low as you can while keeping balance, then push through your foot to rise. Repeat for desired reps and switch sides.

Exercise: Elevated kettlebell single leg goblet squat
Variations: Kettlebell goblet single leg box squat
Regression: Kettlebell goblet single leg box squat
Exercise Description:
1. Stand on a stable elevated surface with one foot, holding a kettlebell close to your chest with both hands.
2. Extend the non-working leg in front of you.
3. Push your hips back while slowly bending the standing knee, lowering your body with chest up and back straight.
4. At the bottom, the extended leg can lightly tap the ground if needed.
5. Push through the standing foot and drive your hips forward to return to the starting position. Repeat for desired reps and switch sides.
Audio Script: Stand on an elevated surface with one foot, holding a kettlebell at your chest. Extend the other leg in front and push your hips back while bending the standing knee. Keep your chest up and back straight. At the bottom, lightly tap the ground with the extended leg if needed, then push through your foot and drive hips forward to rise. Repeat for desired reps and switch sides.

Variations: Front rack kettlebell single leg box squat
Front rack kettlebell elevated single leg goblet squat
Exercise Description:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell in each hand resting on your forearms and biceps, elbows tucked, wrists neutral.
2. Keep your chest upright and maintain a neutral spine throughout the movement.
3. Push your hips back and bend your knees simultaneously to lower into a squat.
4. Lower until your thighs are at least parallel to the ground.
5. Press through your feet to return to standing. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, kettlebells resting on your forearms and biceps, elbows tucked, wrists neutral. Keep chest upright and spine neutral. Push hips back and bend knees to lower until thighs are at least parallel. Press through your feet to stand back up. Repeat for reps.

Variations: Front rack kettlebell single leg box squat
Front rack kettlebell elevated single leg goblet squat
Exercise Description:
1. Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes slightly pointing out, holding a kettlebell in each hand resting on your forearms and biceps, elbows tucked, wrists neutral.
2. Keep your chest upright and maintain a neutral spine throughout the movement.
3. Push your hips back and bend your knees simultaneously to lower into a sumo squat.
4. Lower until your thighs are at least parallel to the ground.
5. Press through your feet to return to standing. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Stand with feet wide, toes slightly out, kettlebells resting on forearms and biceps, elbows tucked, wrists neutral. Keep chest upright and spine neutral. Push hips back and bend knees to lower into a sumo squat until thighs are at least parallel. Press through your feet to stand up. Repeat.

Variations: Front rack kettlebell single leg box squat
Front rack kettlebell elevated single leg goblet squat
Exercise Description:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell in each hand resting on your forearms and biceps, elbows tucked, wrists neutral.
2. Keep your chest upright and maintain a neutral spine.
3. Push your hips back and bend your knees to lower down toward a box or bench behind you.
4. Lightly tap the box with your glutes.
5. Press through your feet to return to standing. Repeat for desired reps.
Audio Script: Stand with feet shoulder-width, kettlebells resting on forearms and biceps, elbows tucked, wrists neutral. Keep chest up and spine neutral. Push hips back and bend knees to lower onto the box, lightly tap with your glutes, then press through your feet to stand. Repeat.

Exercise: Front rack kettlebell single leg box squat
Variations: Front rack kettlebell elevated single leg goblet squat
Regression: Kettlebell goblet single leg box squat
Exercise Description:
1. Stand on one leg with the other leg slightly extended in front of you, holding a kettlebell in each hand resting on your forearms and biceps, elbows tucked, wrists neutral.
2. Keep your chest upright and maintain a neutral spine.
3. Push your hips back and bend the knee of the supporting leg to lower down toward a box or bench behind you.
4. Lightly tap the box with your glutes.
5. Press through the supporting foot to return to standing. Repeat for desired reps, then switch sides.
Audio Script: Stand on one leg, kettlebells resting on forearms and biceps, elbows tucked, wrists neutral. Keep chest up and spine neutral. Push hips back and bend the supporting knee to lower onto the box, lightly tap with your glutes, then press through the foot to stand. Repeat for desired reps and switch sides.

Variations: Front rack kettlebell single leg box squat
Front rack kettlebell elevated single leg goblet squat
Exercise Description:
1. Stand on one leg with the other leg extended in front of you, holding a kettlebell in each hand resting on your forearms and biceps, elbows tucked, wrists neutral.
2. Keep your chest upright and maintain a neutral spine.
3. Push your hips back and bend the knee of the supporting leg to lower down toward the ground.
4. Lower as far as mobility allows while maintaining balance.
5. Press through the supporting foot to return to standing. Repeat for desired reps, then switch sides.
Audio Script: Stand on one leg, kettlebells resting on forearms and biceps, elbows tucked, wrists neutral. Keep chest up. Push hips back and bend the supporting knee to lower down, then press through the foot to stand. Repeat and switch sides.

Exercise: Front rack kettlebell elevated single leg goblet squat
Variations: Front rack kettlebell single leg box squat
Regression: Elevated kettlebell single leg goblet squat
Exercise Description:
1. Stand on one leg on an elevated surface (like a small platform or step), holding two kettlebells in front of your chest, resting on your forearms and biceps, elbows tucked, wrists neutral.
2. Keep your chest upright and core engaged.
3. Push your hips back and bend the knee of the supporting leg to lower down toward the ground.
4. Lower as far as mobility allows while optionally lightly tapping your free leg’s heel to the ground.
5. Press through the supporting foot to return to the starting position. Repeat for desired reps, then switch sides.
Audio Script: Stand on one leg on a platform, holding two kettlebells on your forearms and biceps, elbows tucked. Keep chest up and core tight. Push hips back and bend the supporting knee to lower, lightly tap the other heel if needed, then press through the foot to stand. Repeat and switch sides.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides, palms facing your body.
2. Keep your chest upright and core engaged.
3. Push your hips back and bend your knees to lower into a squat.
4. Lower until thighs are roughly parallel to the ground (or as mobility allows), then press through your feet to return to standing.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides. Keep chest up and core tight. Push hips back and bend knees to lower into a squat, then press through your feet to stand. Repeat for reps.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand overhead with palms facing each other (neutral grip) and arms fully extended.
2. Keep your core tight, chest upright, and gaze forward.
3. Push your hips back and bend your knees to lower into a squat while maintaining the dumbbells overhead.
4. Lower until thighs are roughly parallel to the ground (or as mobility allows), then press through your feet to return to standing.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand overhead with palms facing each other. Keep core tight and chest up. Push hips back and bend knees to lower into a squat, keeping the dumbbells overhead. Press through your feet to stand. Repeat for reps.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, barbell resting across your upper back (trapezius), hands gripping the bar just outside your shoulders.
2. Keep your chest up, core engaged, and gaze forward.
3. Push your hips back and bend your knees, making sure your knees track in line with your toes to prevent caving in.
4. Lower until thighs are roughly parallel to the ground (or as mobility allows), then press through your feet to return to standing.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, barbell resting across your upper back. Keep chest up, core tight, and gaze forward. Push hips back and bend knees, making sure your knees track in line with your toes. Lower until thighs are roughly parallel, then press through your feet to stand. Repeat for reps.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, barbell resting on your front deltoids, close to your throat, elbows lifted and pointing forward, hands gripping the bar just outside your shoulders.
2. Keep your chest up, core tight, and gaze forward.
3. Push your hips back and bend your knees, making sure your knees track in line with your toes to prevent caving in.
4. Lower until thighs are roughly parallel to the ground (or as mobility allows), then press through your heels to return to standing.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, barbell resting on your front delts, elbows pointing forward. Keep chest up, core tight, and gaze forward. Push hips back and bend knees, keeping knees in line with your toes. Lower until thighs are roughly parallel, then press through your heels to stand. Repeat for reps.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand with feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell overhead with arms fully extended, palms facing forward, shoulders active.
2. Keep your chest up, core tight, and gaze forward.
3. Push your hips back and bend your knees, ensuring knees track in line with toes to prevent caving in.
4. Lower your body until thighs are roughly parallel to the ground (or as mobility allows), keeping the barbell over mid-foot.
5. Press through your heels and extend hips and knees to return to standing. Repeat for desired reps.
Audio Script: Stand with feet slightly wider than shoulder-width, bar overhead with arms extended, shoulders active. Keep chest up, core tight, gaze forward. Push hips back and bend knees, keeping knees in line with toes. Lower until thighs are parallel, keeping the bar over your mid-foot. Press through heels to stand and repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell in the crook of your elbows (forearms cradling the bar), arms bent, close to your torso.
2. Keep your chest up, shoulders back, and core tight.
3. Push your hips back and bend your knees, lowering your body down.
4. Lower until your thighs are roughly parallel to the ground, keeping elbows tucked and bar close to your body.
5. Press through your heels to stand, extending hips and knees. Repeat for desired reps.
Audio Script: Stand with feet shoulder-width, bar in the crook of your elbows, arms close to torso. Keep chest up, shoulders back, core tight. Push hips back and bend knees, lowering down until thighs are parallel. Press through heels to stand and repeat.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand on the platform of a belt squat machine with feet shoulder-width apart, and secure the belt around your waist.
2. Keep your chest up, shoulders back, and core tight.
3. Push your hips back and bend your knees, lowering your body down.
4. Lower until your thighs are roughly parallel to the platform.
5. Press through your heels to stand, extending hips and knees. Repeat for desired reps.
Audio Script: Stand on the belt squat platform with feet shoulder-width, belt secured around your waist. Keep chest up and core tight. Push hips back and bend knees, lowering down until thighs are parallel. Press through heels to stand and repeat.

Variations: Single front rack kettlebell bulgarian split squat
Exercise Description:
1. Stand a couple of feet in front of a bench or elevated surface and place one foot on it behind you.
2. Keep your chest up, shoulders back, and core engaged.
3. Push your hips back and bend your front knee, lowering your body until your front thigh is roughly parallel to the ground and the front knee is roughly above the ankle.
4. Keep your weight evenly distributed through your front foot.
5. Press through the front heel to stand and repeat for desired reps, then switch legs.
Audio Script: Stand a few feet from a bench with one foot on it behind you. Keep chest up and core tight. Push hips back and bend the front knee, lowering until thigh is parallel and the knee is roughly above the ankle. Keep weight evenly on the front foot. Press through the front heel to stand and repeat, then switch sides.

Variations: Single front rack kettlebell bulgarian split squat
Exercise Description:
1. Stand a couple of feet in front of a bench or elevated surface and place one foot on it behind you.
2. Keep your chest up, shoulders back, and core engaged.
3. Push your hips back and bend your front knee, lowering your body into a deep lunge. Front knee is roughly above the ankle.

1. Hold a kettlebell in each hand in a front rack position (resting on forearms and biceps, elbows tucked, wrists neutral).
2. Stand upright on an elevated surface (e.g., step or small platform) with feet shoulder-width apart.
3. Step backward with one leg off the elevated surface and bend both knees simultaneously to lower your body. Keep the front knee roughly over the ankle and pointing in the same direction as your toes.
4. Push through the front foot to return to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps on the working leg before switching sides.
Audio Script: Hold a kettlebell in each hand in a front rack position on your forearms and biceps, elbows tucked, wrists neutral. Step backward off the elevated surface with one leg and bend both knees to lower into a lunge, keeping the front knee over the ankle. Push through the front foot to return to start. Repeat for reps on that side, then switch legs.

Double front rack kettlebell deficit lunges
Single arm front rack kettlebell deficit lunge
Alternating deficit reverse lunges with bicep curls
Exercise Description:
1. Hold a dumbbell in one hand on the same side as the working leg.
2. Stand upright on an elevated surface (e.g., step or small platform) with feet shoulder-width apart.
3. Step backward with the opposite leg off the elevated surface and bend both knees simultaneously to lower your body. Keep the front knee roughly over the ankle and pointing in the same direction as your toes.
4. Push through the front foot to return to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps on the working leg before switching sides.
Audio Script: Hold a dumbbell in one hand on the same side as the working leg. Step backward off the elevated surface with the other leg and bend both knees to lower into a lunge, keeping the front knee over the ankle. Push through the front foot to return to start. Repeat for reps on that side, then switch legs.
