Exercise: Alternating deficit reverse lunges with bicep curls
Variations: Bodyweight deficit lunges with rear leg raise
Dumbbell deficit lunges with rear leg raise
Double front rack kettlebell deficit lunges
Single arm front rack kettlebell deficit lunge
Exercise Description:
1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides, palms facing your body.
2. Stand upright on an elevated surface (e.g., step or small platform) with feet shoulder-width apart.
3. Step backward with one leg off the platform and bend both knees simultaneously to lower your body into a reverse lunge. Keep the front knee roughly over the ankle and pointing in the same direction as your toes.
4. Simultaneously curl the dumbbells toward your shoulders, twisting your wrists so your palms face forward at the top of the curl.
5. Push through the front foot to return to the starting position. Step backward with the other leg and repeat, continuing to alternate legs for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Hold a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing your body. Step backward off the platform into a lunge, keeping the front knee over the ankle. Curl the dumbbells as you lunge, rotating your wrists so palms face forward. Push through the front foot to return to start, then step back with the other leg and continue alternating for reps.

Variations: Single leg glute bridge with abduction
Exercise Description:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart. Arms should rest at your sides.
2. Engage your core and glutes.
3. Press through your heels to lift your hips toward the ceiling until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
4. Hold the top position for a moment, squeezing your glutes.
5. Slowly lower your hips back to the floor and repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat. Engage your core and glutes, then press through your heels to lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees. Hold, squeeze, and lower back down. Repeat for reps.

Variations: Single leg glute bridge with abduction
Progression: Single leg glute bridge with abduction
Exercise Description:
1. Lie on your back with one knee bent and foot flat on the floor, and the other leg extended straight. Arms should rest at your sides.
2. Engage your core and glutes.
3. Press through the heel of the bent leg to lift your hips toward the ceiling, forming a straight line from shoulders to extended foot.
4. Hold the top position for a moment, squeezing your glutes.
5. Slowly lower your hips back to the floor and repeat for the desired number of reps on that leg before switching sides.
Audio Script: Lie on your back with one foot flat and the other leg extended. Engage your core and glutes, then press through the bent leg to lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to the extended foot. Hold, squeeze, and lower back down. Repeat for reps, then switch legs.

Variations: Single leg glute bridge with abduction
Exercise Description:
1. Place a mini loop band just above your knees. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart. Arms should rest at your sides.
2. Engage your core and glutes.
3. Press through your heels to lift your hips toward the ceiling until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
4. At the top, push your knees outward against the band to perform hip abduction, then return knees to hip-width distance.
5. Slowly lower your hips back to the floor and repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Place a mini loop band just above your knees. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat. Engage your core and glutes, lift your hips to form a straight line from shoulders to knees, and push your knees outward against the band. Lower back down and repeat for reps.

Exercise: Single leg glute bridge with abduction
Progression: Single leg hip thrust with abduction
Exercise Description:
1. Place a mini loop band just above your knees. Lie on your back with one knee bent and foot flat on the floor, and the other leg extended straight. Arms should rest at your sides.
2. Engage your core and glutes.
3. Press through the heel of the bent leg to lift your hips toward the ceiling, forming a straight line from shoulders to extended foot.
4. At the top, push the extended leg outward against the band to perform hip abduction, then return the leg to its starting position.
5. Slowly lower your hips back to the floor and repeat for the desired number of reps on that leg before switching sides.
Audio Script: Place a mini loop band above your knees. Lie on your back with one foot flat and the other leg extended. Engage your core and glutes, lift your hips to form a straight line, and push the extended leg outward against the band. Lower back down and repeat for reps, then switch legs.

Variations: Single leg hip thrust with abduction
Exercise Description:
1. Sit on the floor with your upper back resting against a bench or elevated surface, knees bent and feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart.
2. Place your hands on your hips or lightly behind your neck, whichever feels comfortable.
3. Engage your core and glutes.
4. Press through your heels to lift your hips toward the ceiling until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees, keeping your knees roughly above your ankles.
5. Slowly lower your hips back down and repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Sit on the floor with your upper back against a bench, knees bent and feet flat. Place your hands on your hips or lightly behind your neck. Engage your core and glutes, press through your heels to lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees, keeping knees above ankles. Lower back down and repeat for reps.

Variations: Single leg hip thrust with abduction
Exercise Description:
1. Place a mini loop band just above your knees. Sit on the floor with your upper back resting against a bench or elevated surface, knees bent and feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart.
2. Place your hands on your hips or lightly behind your neck, whichever feels comfortable.
3. Engage your core and glutes.
4. Press through your heels to lift your hips toward the ceiling until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees, keeping your knees roughly above your ankles. At the top, push your knees outward against the band to perform hip abduction, then return them to hip-width distance.
5. Slowly lower your hips back down and repeat for the desired number of reps.

Engage your core and glutes, lift your hips to form a straight line, and push your knees outward against the band. Lower back down and repeat for reps.

Variations: Single leg hip thrust with abduction
Exercise Description:
1. Sit on the floor with your upper back resting against a bench or elevated surface, knees bent and feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart.
2. Roll a barbell over your legs and position it across your hips. You can hold the barbell with hands for stability or use a pad for comfort.
3. Engage your core and glutes.
4. Press through your heels to lift your hips toward the ceiling until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees, keeping your knees roughly above your ankles.
5. Slowly lower your hips back down and repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Sit on the floor with your upper back against a bench, knees bent and feet flat. Place a barbell across your hips, using your hands or a pad for comfort. Engage your core and glutes, lift your hips to form a straight line from shoulders to knees, keeping knees above ankles. Lower back down and repeat for reps.

Exercise Description:

Variations: Single leg hip thrust with abduction
Exercise Description:

Engage your core and glutes, lift your hips through the bent leg to form a straight line, keeping the knee over the ankle. Lower back down and repeat for reps, then switch legs.

Variations: Single leg elevated hip thrusts tricep extension
Exercise Description:
1. Lie on your back on the floor with your heels resting on an elevated surface (e.g., bench or step) and knees bent, hip-width apart. Arms should rest at your sides for support.
2. Engage your core and glutes.
3. Press through your heels to lift your hips toward the ceiling until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees, emphasizing hamstring engagement.
4. Hold the top position briefly, squeezing your glutes and hamstrings.
5. Slowly lower your hips back down and repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Lie on the floor with your heels on an elevated surface and knees bent. Engage your core and glutes, press through your heels to lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees, focusing on your hamstrings. Hold, then lower back down and repeat for reps.

Animation name: Legs/Bodyweight Feet Elevated Figure Four Glute Bridge_Female
Variations: Single leg elevated hip thrusts tricep extension
Exercise Description:
1. Lie on your back on the floor with one heel resting on an elevated surface (e.g., bench or step) and the other leg extended straight. The bent leg’s knee should be at roughly 90 degrees, hip-width apart. Arms should rest at your sides for support.
2. Engage your core and glutes.
3. Press through the heel of the bent leg to lift your hips toward the ceiling, forming a straight line from shoulders to extended foot.
4. Hold the top position briefly, squeezing your glutes and hamstrings.
5. Slowly lower your hips back down and repeat for the desired number of reps on that leg before switching sides.
Audio Script: Lie on the floor with one heel on an elevated surface and the other leg extended. Keep the bent leg’s knee at roughly 90 degrees. Engage your core and glutes, lift your hips through the bent leg until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to extended foot. Hold, then lower back down and repeat for reps, then switch legs.

Variations: Single leg elevated hip thrusts tricep extension
Progression: Single leg elevated hip thrusts tricep extension
Exercise Description:
1. Lie on your back on the floor with your heels resting on an elevated surface (e.g., bench or step), knees bent, hip-width apart. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with a neutral grip (palms facing each other) and arms extended over your chest.
2. Engage your core and glutes.
3. Press through your heels to lift your hips toward the ceiling until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
4. While holding the top position, bend your elbows to lower the dumbbells toward your forehead (like a neutral-grip skull crusher), then extend your arms back to the starting position.
5. Slowly lower your hips back to the floor and repeat the hip thrust and tricep extension sequence for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Lie on the floor with your heels on an elevated surface, knees bent. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing each other. Engage your core and glutes, lift your hips to form a straight line from shoulders to knees. While holding the top, bend your elbows to lower the dumbbells toward your forehead, then extend back up. Lower hips and repeat for reps.

Exercise: Single leg elevated hip thrusts tricep extension
Exercise Description:
1. Lie on your back on the floor with one heel resting on an elevated surface (e.g., bench or step) and the other leg extended straight. Hold a dumbbell in one hand with a neutral grip (palm facing inward), arm extended over your chest.
2. Place your other hand on your hip or the floor for stability.
3. Engage your core and glutes.
4. Press through the heel of the bent leg to lift your hips toward the ceiling, forming a straight line from shoulders to extended foot. Keep the bent leg’s knee roughly at 90 degrees.
5. While holding the top position, bend the elbow of the working arm to lower the weight toward your forehead, then extend it back to the starting position. Slowly lower your hips and repeat for the desired number of reps before switching sides.
Audio Script: Lie on the floor with one heel on an elevated surface and the other leg extended. Hold a dumbbell in one hand with the palm facing inward, other hand on your hip or floor. Engage your core and glutes, lift your hips to form a straight line. While holding the top, bend the elbow to lower the weight toward your forehead, then extend back up. Lower hips and repeat for reps, then switch sides.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart, toes pointing forward or slightly outward. Place a barbell on the floor in front of your shins.
2. Hinge at the hips and bend your knees to grip the barbell with hands just outside your knees, using either a double overhand or mixed grip. Keep your back flat and chest up.
3. Engage your core, pull your shoulder blades back, and maintain a neutral spine.
4. Drive through your heels, extend your hips and knees simultaneously to lift the barbell along your legs until standing fully upright.
5. Lower the barbell under control by hinging at the hips and bending your knees, keeping the bar close to your body, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Stand with feet hip-width apart and barbell in front. Hinge at the hips and bend your knees to grip the bar, back flat and chest up. Engage your core, lift the bar by extending hips and knees, then lower it along your legs under control. Repeat for reps.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding a PVC pipe along your spine so it touches your head, upper back, and tailbone.
2. Engage your core and keep your back neutral.
3. Hinge at the hips by pushing your hips backward, allowing your torso to lean forward while keeping the PVC pipe in contact with your head, upper back, and tailbone. Slightly bend your knees as needed for comfort.
4. Pause at the end of the hinge when you feel a stretch in your hamstrings.
5. Return to the starting position by driving your hips forward and standing upright. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding a PVC pipe along your spine. Engage your core, hinge at the hips by pushing them back, keeping the pipe touching your head, upper back, and tailbone. Pause, then drive your hips forward to return to standing. Repeat for reps.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes slightly pointed outward. Position a barbell on the floor over your mid-foot.
2. Hinge at the hips and bend your knees to grip the bar with hands inside your legs, using an overhand grip. Keep your chest up and back flat.
3. Engage your core, pull your shoulder blades back, and maintain a neutral spine.
4. Drive through your heels, extend your hips and knees simultaneously to lift the barbell until standing fully upright.
5. Lower the barbell under control by hinging at the hips and bending your knees, keeping the bar close to your body, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width, toes slightly out, barbell over mid-foot. Grip the bar with hands inside your legs, back flat and chest up. Engage your core, lift the bar by extending hips and knees, then lower under control. Repeat for reps.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand inside a hex/trap bar with feet hip-width apart, toes pointing forward. Grip the handles with palms facing your body. 
2. Engage your core and maintain a neutral spine.
3. Hinge at your hips and bend your knees slightly to prepare for the lift, keeping your chest up.
4. Drive through your heels, extend your hips and knees simultaneously to lift the bar until standing fully upright.
5. Lower the bar under control by hinging at the hips and bending your knees, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Stand inside a hex/trap bar with feet hip-width apart and grip the handles, bar on the floor. Engage your core, hinge at the hips, and bend your knees. Drive through your heels to lift the bar by extending hips and knees, then lower under control. Repeat for reps.

Exercise Description:
1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand in front of your thighs, palms facing your legs. Stand upright with feet hip-width apart.
2. Engage your core and maintain a neutral spine.
3. Slightly bend your knees and hinge at the hips to lower the dumbbells along the front of your legs. Keep your chest up and back flat.
4. Lower until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings, usually just below the knees.
5. Drive your hips forward to return to standing, squeezing your glutes at the top, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Hold a dumbbell in each hand in front of your thighs, palms facing your legs. Stand with feet hip-width apart, core engaged, back neutral. Slightly bend your knees and hinge at the hips to lower the dumbbells along your legs until you feel a hamstring stretch. Drive your hips forward to stand and squeeze your glutes. Repeat for reps.

Exercise Description:
1. Hold a barbell in front of your thighs with a pronated grip (palms facing your legs). Stand upright with feet hip-width apart.
2. Engage your core and maintain a neutral spine.
3. Slightly bend your knees and hinge at the hips to lower the barbell along the front of your legs. Keep your chest up and back flat.
4. Lower until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings, usually just below the knees.
5. Drive your hips forward to return to standing, squeezing your glutes at the top, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Hold a barbell in front of your thighs, palms facing your legs. Stand with feet hip-width apart, core engaged, back neutral. Slightly bend your knees and hinge at the hips to lower the bar along your legs until you feel a hamstring stretch. Drive your hips forward to stand and squeeze your glutes. Repeat for reps.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand upright on one leg with the other leg slightly bent behind you. Keep your standing foot hip-width apart for balance.
2. Engage your core and maintain a neutral spine.
3. Hinge at the hips, lowering your torso forward while extending the non-standing leg straight behind you. Keep your back flat and arms extended toward the floor or in front of you for balance.
4. Lower until you feel a stretch in the hamstring of the standing leg.
5. Drive your hips forward to return to standing, squeezing your glutes at the top, then repeat for the desired number of reps before switching legs.
Audio Script: Stand on one leg with the other leg extended behind you. Engage your core, hinge at the hips to lower your torso while keeping the back flat and arms extended forward. Feel the stretch in the standing leg’s hamstring, then return to standing and squeeze your glutes. Repeat for reps, then switch legs.

Exercise Description:
1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand in front of your thighs, palms facing your legs. Stand on one leg with the other leg slightly bent behind you.
2. Engage your core and maintain a neutral spine.
3. Hinge at the hips, lowering the dumbbells along the front of your standing leg while extending the non-standing leg straight behind you. Keep your back flat.
4. Lower until you feel a stretch in the hamstring of the standing leg.
5. Drive your hips forward to return to standing, squeezing your glutes at the top, then repeat for the desired number of reps before switching legs.
Audio Script: Hold a dumbbell in each hand in front of your thighs, palms facing your legs. Stand on one leg with the other extended behind you. Engage your core, hinge at the hips, and lower the dumbbells along the front of the standing leg. Feel the hamstring stretch, then return to standing and squeeze your glutes. Repeat for reps, then switch legs.

Exercise Description:
1. Position yourself under a Smith machine bar, resting it across your upper back (trapezius). Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Engage your core and maintain a neutral spine.
3. With a slight bend in your knees, hinge at the hips to lean your torso forward while keeping your back flat.
4. Lower until your torso is roughly parallel to the floor or you feel a stretch in your hamstrings.
5. Drive your hips forward to return to standing, keeping your chest up, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Position yourself under a Smith machine bar on your upper back, feet shoulder-width apart. Engage your core, hinge at the hips with a slight knee bend, and lean forward keeping your back flat. Lower until your torso is roughly parallel to the floor, then drive your hips forward to stand. Repeat for reps.

Exercise Description:
1. Position a barbell across your upper back (trapezius), standing with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Engage your core and maintain a neutral spine.
3. With a slight bend in your knees, hinge at the hips to lean your torso forward while keeping your back flat.
4. Lower until your torso is roughly parallel to the floor or you feel a stretch in your hamstrings.
5. Drive your hips forward to return to standing, keeping your chest up, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Place a barbell across your upper back, feet shoulder-width apart. Engage your core, hinge at the hips with a slight knee bend, and lean forward keeping your back flat. Lower until your torso is roughly parallel to the floor, then drive your hips forward to stand. Repeat for reps.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand upright facing a sturdy platform or bench, feet hip-width apart.
2. Engage your core and keep your chest up.
3. Step onto the platform with one foot, pressing through the heel to lift your body up until your standing leg is fully extended.
4. Slowly lower your body back down to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps on the working leg before switching sides.
Audio Script: Stand facing a sturdy platform, feet hip-width apart. Step onto the platform with one foot, pressing through the heel to lift your body. Slowly lower back down. Repeat for reps on that side, then switch legs.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand upright facing a sturdy platform or bench, feet hip-width apart.
2. Engage your core and keep your chest up.
3. Step onto the platform with one foot, pressing through the heel to lift your body up until your standing leg is fully extended.
4. At the top, extend the non-working leg straight back and upward, performing a glute kickback.
5. Lower the non-working leg and your body back to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of reps on the working leg before switching sides.
Audio Script: Stand facing a sturdy platform. Step up with one foot, pressing through the heel to lift your body. At the top, extend the other leg back and up for a glute kickback, then lower back down. Repeat for reps, then switch legs.

Exercise Description:
1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides, palms facing your body.
2. Stand upright facing a sturdy platform or bench, feet hip-width apart.
3. Step onto the platform with one foot, pressing through the heel to lift your body until your standing leg is fully extended.
4. Slowly lower your body back down to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps on the working leg before switching sides.
Audio Script: Hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides. Step onto a platform, pressing through the heel to lift your body. Lower back down and repeat for reps, then switch legs.

Exercise Description:
1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides, palms facing your body.
2. Stand upright facing a sturdy platform or bench, feet hip-width apart.
3. Step onto the platform with one foot, pressing through the heel to lift your body while simultaneously curling the dumbbells toward your shoulders.
4. Lower the dumbbells as you step back down to the starting position.
5. Step up with the other leg and repeat, continuing to alternate legs for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides. Step onto a platform, curling the dumbbells toward your shoulders as you lift. Lower back down and repeat, alternating legs for reps.

Exercise Description:
1. Sit on the horizontal leg press machine with your back and head against the pad, feet flat on the platform hip-width apart.
2. Place your hands on the handles for support.
3. Engage your core and press through your heels to extend your legs, fully straightening your knees without locking them.
4. Slowly bend your knees to lower the platform toward your body under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Sit on the machine with back against the pad, feet flat on the platform. Press through your heels to extend your legs, then slowly bend your knees to lower the platform. Repeat for reps.

Exercise Description:
1. Sit on the 45-degree leg press machine with your back and head against the pad, feet flat on the platform hip-width apart.
2. Place your hands on the handles for support.
3. Engage your core and press through your heels to extend your legs, fully straightening your knees without locking them.

4. Hold this position for the desired duration.
5. Slowly lower your hips back to the ground and repeat for the other side.
Audio Script: Lie on your side with forearm on the ground and knees bent. Lift your hips to form a straight line from knees to shoulders, engage core and glutes, hold, then switch sides.

Exercise Description:
1. Start on your side with your forearm on the ground under your shoulder and legs extended straight, stacked on top of each other.
2. Engage your core and glutes.
3. Lift your hips off the ground to form a straight line from head to feet.
4. Hold this position for the desired duration.
5. Slowly lower your hips and repeat for the other side.
Audio Script: Lie on your side with forearm on the ground and legs straight. Lift your hips to form a straight line from head to feet, engage core and glutes, hold, then switch sides.

Exercise Description:
1. Start in a side plank position on your forearm, legs extended and stacked, with your top hand holding a dumbbell on your hip.
2. Engage your core and glutes, keeping your spine neutral.
3. Lift your hips off the ground to form a straight line from head to feet.
4. Hold this position for the desired duration.
5. Slowly lower your hips and repeat for the other side.
Audio Script: Hold a side plank on your forearm with legs stacked, top hand holding a dumbbell on your hip. Lift hips to form a straight line, hold, then lower. Repeat on the other side.

Exercise Description:
1. Start on all fours with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Engage your core and keep your back flat.
3. Extend one arm forward and the opposite leg backward, keeping both straight.
4. Hold this position for the desired duration while maintaining a neutral spine.
5. Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.
Audio Script: Start on all fours. Extend one arm forward and the opposite leg back, hold while keeping spine neutral, then return. Repeat on the other side.

Exercise Description:
1. Start on all fours with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Engage your core and keep your back flat.
3. Extend one arm forward and the opposite leg backward.
4. Return the arm and leg to the starting position under control.
5. Alternate sides and continue for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Start on all fours. Extend one arm forward and opposite leg back, then return. Alternate sides for reps.

Variations: Lying leg raises with band abduction
Lying leg raises with stability ball
Lying leg raises with kettlebell pullover
Progression: Lying leg raises with stability ball
Exercise Description:
1. Lie flat on your back with legs extended and arms at your sides.
2. Engage your core and press your lower back into the floor.
3. Lift both legs toward the ceiling while keeping them straight.
4. Lower your legs back down under control without letting your lower back arch.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Lie on your back with legs extended. Lift both legs up toward the ceiling, lower slowly without arching your back, and repeat for reps.

Exercise: Lying leg raises with band abduction
Variations: Lying leg raises with stability ball
Lying leg raises with kettlebell pullover
Exercise Description:
1. Lie flat on your back with a mini loop band around your thighs just above the knees, legs extended and arms at your sides.
2. Engage your core and press your lower back into the floor.
3. Lift your legs toward the ceiling while pushing your knees outward against the band.
4. Lower your legs under control without letting your lower back arch.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Lie on your back with a mini loop band above your knees. Lift your legs up while pushing knees outward against the band, lower slowly, and repeat for reps.

Exercise: Lying leg raises with stability ball
Variations: Lying leg raises with band abduction
Lying leg raises with kettlebell pullover
Exercise Description:
1. Lie on your back with a stability ball held between your feet, arms at your sides for support.
2. Engage your core and press your lower back into the floor.
3. Lift your legs and the ball toward the ceiling while keeping your legs straight.
4. Slowly lower your legs and the ball under control without letting your lower back arch.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Lie on your back holding a stability ball between your feet. Lift your legs and the ball toward the ceiling, lower slowly without arching your back, and repeat for reps.

Exercise: Lying leg raises with kettlebell pullover
Variations: Lying leg raises with band abduction
Lying leg raises with stability ball
Exercise Description:
1. Lie on your back with a kettlebell held in both hands overhead, arms extended, and legs straight on the floor.
2. Engage your core and press your lower back into the floor.
3. Simultaneously lift your legs and pull the kettlebell toward your shins, bringing them together in a controlled motion.
4. Slowly lower your legs and return the kettlebell to the starting overhead position.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Lie on your back with a kettlebell overhead and legs straight. Lift your legs and pull the kettlebell toward your shins, then slowly return to the starting position. Repeat for reps.

Animation name: Abdominals/Suspension Trainer with Grips Hanging Leg Hip Raise
Variations: Lying leg raises with band abduction
Lying leg raises with stability ball
Lying leg raises with kettlebell pullover
Exercise Description:
1. Hang from a pull-up bar with an overhand grip, arms fully extended, and feet together.
2. Engage your core and keep your spine neutral.
3. Lift your knees toward your chest while keeping them bent.
4. Slowly lower your legs back to the starting position under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Hang from a pull-up bar. Lift your knees toward your chest, then lower slowly. Repeat for reps.

Animation name: Abdominals/Suspension Trainer with Grips Hanging Straight Leg Hip Raise_female
Variations: Lying leg raises with band abduction
Lying leg raises with stability ball
Lying leg raises with kettlebell pullover
Exercise Description:
1. Hang from a pull-up bar with an overhand grip, arms fully extended, and feet together.
2. Engage your core and keep your spine neutral.
3. Lift your legs straight in front of you toward the ceiling.
4. Slowly lower your legs back to the starting position under control without swinging.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Hang from a pull-up bar. Lift your legs straight in front of you, lower slowly without swinging, and repeat for reps.

Exercise Description:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor, arms crossed over your chest or hands behind your head.
2. Engage your core.
3. Curl your shoulders and upper back off the floor, keeping your lower back pressed.
4. Pause briefly at the top.
5. Slowly lower back to the starting position and repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Lie on your back with knees bent. Curl your shoulders off the floor, pause briefly, then lower back down. Repeat for reps.

Exercise Description:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor, hands resting near your thighs.
2. Engage your core.
3. Slide your hands up toward your knees as you curl your shoulders and upper back off the floor.
4. Pause briefly at the top of the movement.
5. Slowly lower back to the starting position and repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Lie on your back with knees bent. Slide your hands toward your knees as you curl your shoulders off the floor, then lower slowly. Repeat for reps.

Exercise Description:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Hold a weight plate or dumbbell against your chest or extended above your chest.
2. Engage your core.
3. Curl your shoulders and upper back off the floor, keeping your lower back pressed.
4. Pause briefly at the top, squeezing your abdominals.
5. Slowly lower back to the starting position and repeat for the desired number of reps.
Audio Script: Lie on your back holding a weight against or above your chest. Curl shoulders off the floor, squeeze abs at the top, then lower slowly. Repeat for reps.

Exercise Description:
1. Start in a high plank position with hands under shoulders and feet together.
2. Engage your core and keep your spine neutral.
3. Drive one knee toward your chest, then quickly switch legs in a running-like motion.
4. Continue alternating legs at a controlled but consistent pace.
5. Repeat for the desired number duration.
Audio Script: Start in a plank position. Drive one knee toward your chest, then switch legs quickly, alternating for duration.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand upright holding a dumbbell in one hand at your side.
2. Engage your core and keep your shoulders squared, spine neutral.
3. Walk forward for a designated distance or time, resisting lateral tilt from the weight.
4. Maintain an upright posture throughout.
5. Switch sides and repeat for the same distance or duration.
Audio Script: Hold a dumbbell in one hand at your side. Engage your core, walk forward resisting tilt, then switch sides. Repeat for distance or time.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand perpendicular to a cable machine with the handle held at chest level, arms bent, and feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Engage your core and keep your torso upright.
3. Press the handle straight out in front of you, resisting rotation.
4. Hold this position for the desired duration.
5. Slowly return to chest level and repeat for reps or hold on the other side.
Audio Script: Stand perpendicular to a cable, hold handle at chest, press straight out while resisting rotation. Hold or return slowly, then repeat on the other side.

Exercise Description:
1. Stand perpendicular to a cable machine with the handle held at chest level, arms bent, and feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Engage your core and keep your torso upright.
3. Press the handle straight out in front of you and slowly bring it back toward your chest.
4. Perform this pressing motion dynamically while resisting rotation.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch sides.
Audio Script: Stand perpendicular to a cable, hold the handle at chest. Press it straight out and back dynamically while resisting rotation. Repeat for reps, then switch sides.

Exercise Description:
1. Attach a handle to a loop band anchored at chest height. Stand perpendicular to the anchor, holding the handle at chest level with arms bent and feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Engage your core and keep your torso upright.
3. Press the handle straight out in front of you, resisting rotation.
4. Hold this position for the desired duration.
5. Slowly return to chest level and repeat on the other side.
Audio Script: Stand perpendicular to a loop band anchored at chest height, holding the handle at chest. Press straight out, resist rotation, hold, then return. Repeat on the other side.

Exercise Description:
1. Attach a handle to a loop band anchored at chest height. Stand perpendicular to the anchor, holding the handle at chest level with arms bent and feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Engage your core and keep your torso upright.
3. Press the handle straight out in front of you and then back toward your chest dynamically, resisting rotation.
4. Maintain control throughout the movement.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch sides.
Audio Script: Stand perpendicular to a loop band anchored at chest height, holding the handle at chest. Press out and back dynamically while resisting rotation. Repeat for reps, then switch sides.

Exercise Description:
1. Attach a handle to a high pulley on a cable machine. Stand next to the pulley with feet shoulder-width apart, holding the handle with both hands.
2. Engage your core and keep a slight bend in your knees.
3. Pull the handle diagonally down across your body toward the opposite hip in a controlled chopping motion.
4. Slowly return to the starting position.
5. Repeat for reps, then switch sides.
Audio Script: Hold a cable handle from a high pulley. Pull diagonally down across your body toward opposite hip, then return slowly. Repeat for reps, then switch sides.

Exercise Description:
1. Attach a handle to a low pulley on a cable machine. Stand next to the pulley with feet shoulder-width apart, holding the handle with both hands.
2. Engage your core and maintain a slight bend in your knees.
3. Pull the handle diagonally upward across your body toward the opposite shoulder in a controlled chopping motion.
4. Slowly return to the starting position.
5. Repeat for reps, then switch sides.
Audio Script: Hold a cable handle from a low pulley. Pull diagonally up across your body toward opposite shoulder, then return slowly. Repeat for reps, then switch sides.
